loans.use: to buy flour, salt and firewood for baking lepeshki

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 34 year old father of two living in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. Mohammad has been married for almost 10 years and works hard to provide his family with improved living conditions.   
In addition to his work with the Palestinian Sports Committee, Mohammad opened his own Karate club and started working on developing his business since 2009. Mohammad is asking for the first time from Kiva field partner Ibdaa for a 2,569,000 Lebanese pounds loan to buy new equipment and renovate his club, in order to attract more members in the club and increase his profit. Mohammad participates in many karate and kick-Boxing championships,he is an athletic man, has a big number of members in his Karate club and a very good reputation in the camp.

loans.use: To renovate his Gym

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad has been working in chicken sales since he was 13 years old. He is now 29, married with two kids and living in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. In early 2013, after 14 years of experience in the market, Mohammad established his own shop inside the camp. His goal is to maintain a good relation with the big suppliers which will allow him to invest in his own shop and start supplying small sellers himself. 
Mohammad is asking for a 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. His is planning on using the money to increase his supplies in chicken and sell them back on the market.

loans.use: to buy and sell chicken

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 52 years old and married.

Melissa is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Melissa has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wagon tires and spare parts for her son's transportation service business.

loans.name: Izat

texts.ru: Это Изат. Она из района Пяндж. Ей 46 лет. Изат замужем. У нее 2 сыновей. Сыновьям  16 и 22 лет. Старший сын женат, и находится загранице, чтобы зарабатывать и помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Муж занимается ремонтам дома. Сама Изат занимается земледелием. На работе ей помогает муж и невестка. У нее имеется земельный участок. Она на половине земли сажала картофель и лук. Сейчас Изат готовить почву к новому посеву урожай. Изат на половине часть землю решила сажать огурцы, помидоры и кукуруза. Она просит кредит для купли семян огурцы, помидор и кукуруза.
texts.en: This is Izat. She is from the Pyandj region. She is 46 years old. She is married and has two sons who are 16 and 22 years old. Her eldest son is married and works abroad to earn money and help his parents provide for the family. Her husband works in home renovation. Izat herself is a farmer. Her husband and daughter-in-law help her in her work. She has a parcel of land. She has planted potatoes and onions on half the land. Now Izat is preparing the ground to sow new crops. Izat has decided to plant cucumbers, tomatoes and corn on half of the land. She is asking for a loan to buy cucumber, tomato and corn seeds.

loans.use: to buy cucumber, tomato and corn seeds.

loans.name: Leon

texts.en: Leon is 48 years old, married and had three children attending school. He is a tricycle driver providing motorcycle transport business within their village. Leon joined ASKI because he had insufficient fund to maintain his business. So he is asking for additional capital of P5,000 to buy gasoline and to repair the existing problem with his motorcycle. Someday, he hopes to improve his income for the overall welfare of his family. He will pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and repair the existing problems with his motorcycle

loans.name: 14 Minh Thắng Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs In is a fisherwoman and she is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish for sale. She is 43 years old and she is married with 3 children. Mrs In is the group leader of the 14 Minh Thắng Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish for sale

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 40 years old and married, with four children. With four children in school, Jenny works very hard to provide for them.

Jenny runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like bread, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Jenny has been in this business for five years and she sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like bread, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nida has been in this business for 27 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 27,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Alma has been in this business for 16 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Yelpin village with her husband and four year old daughter. 
Her husband is an electrician. Armine's only occupation is in farming. She keeps a herd of three cows, a calf and fifteen hens. 
Armine takes care of their farm with great love and pleasure and the income gathered from farming business helps her family a lot to cover basic daily expenses.
 
She has now applied for this loan to purchase four oxen, fertilizer and pesticides needed for the farm. 
As this is Armine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. She and her husband will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for four oxen, fertilizer and pesticides needed for the farm

location.town: Yelpin village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 53-year-old married mother of six children. Four years ago, due to increasing living costs and her husband's limited income, she started tailoring and selling clothes and shoes to cover the needs and expenses of her beloved kids.

Layla is a hard worker and sacrifing mother who is working hard and trying desperately to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy fashionable textiles which will help her tailor special clothes for her customers, as she wants to help her son in opening his own business.

Layla hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and to stay capable of providing her family with better life.

loans.use: to develop her business through buying fashionable textiles and help her son in opening his own business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia, 57, is married and has five children. Her husband works as a casual laborer in construction but earns just enough for hand-to-mouth needs. She was striving hard to earn a living without a stable job. The education of her three children and the day-to-day expenses were challenging, so she decided to open a store selling basic commodities.  

They were thankful that they joined Paglaum MPC. With very little capital, they were able to start their sari-sari (general store) business. Their daily sales go the extra mile for the family's needs. They were also able to save with their extra income. 

They have applied to Paglaum MPC for additional capital of PHP 10,000. They say they were attracted to Paglaum MPC for its savings and insurance services. They want to gradually expand their little store and taste a good life someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for sari-sari store.

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en:
Roziya is an honest woman. She was born in a southern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is living in village where conditions for doing agriculture business in most common. She is married and has four children. Her husband is working at a domestic company. In order to help her husband and feed their family she does business in agriculture. For almost 15 years she has planted agricultural products in their yard and sold the harvest that she gains from planting. 

This coming season she needs to fertilize and process her land in order to have a good harvest. She is asking for financial support from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals for her yard. She hopes to be supported and that she can help her husband to feed their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals for her yard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to remodel her bathrooms.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 51 years old and married with five children. The family lives in Dumagoc, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Fe has rented a space in the fish market where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return and enabling her to support the needs of their big family. 

Since Fe wants to generate more income, Fe joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. 

Fe has now applied for a loan of 19,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the public market at nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Usman

texts.en: Usman has had a motorcycle spare parts store for two years. He is living in Pagadian, Zamboanga del Sur. He is blessed with a child and happily married. He used his loan to buy motorcycle spare parts, lubricants, etc. for his business. He is now on his way to repay the loan with his profits.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts, lubricants, etc

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 56 years old, married, and has two children. She is engaged in a banana production for a living and is also able to help her husband as a farmer. She wants a better living for her family. That’s why she borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm to produce a good harvest and have plenty of bananas to be delivered in the market. Julieta wants to save money out from her business for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her banana production.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 33 years old and a resident of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has three kids, one of whom is in college.  She owns a "sari-sari store" (small grocery store) that forms part of their house, and her neighbors are their clients. 

Since she has a college student to support, she has decided to improve their small business to support their children. She operates a motor transport business for additional income. 

So she has requested a loan at Paglaum MPC to buy motor spare parts and lubricants. Aside from the financial assistance, she also received add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. 

She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to buy motor spare parts and lubricants

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is hardworking father of one child and a good husband.  He is very happy because his pig raising is improving, same as his flower business.  

Ricky applied another loan amounting to 50,000 PHP, which is used to buy materials for a fence and fertilizer for his flower business.  

He wants to pay the term of his loan in timely manner , so that he can avail another loan and would maintain a good repayment record.

loans.use: to buy materials for a pig fence and fertilizer for his flower business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 43 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She is married with three children. Marlyn has a sari-sari (general) store and has had this business for five years. 

She has requested a loan to buy two piglets and a sack of feeds for another source of income. Marlyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and a sack of feeds

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 63 years old, widowed and has nine children.

Lucia is in the agricultural business of raising chickens in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Lucia has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets.

Charlene has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 43 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Emily has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Emily would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats to fatten and resell them.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 26, is a dairy farmer from Kiratina location in Kenya. David started farming when he was 16 years old. Over the years, he has made several great strides including owning a 0.5 acre piece of land, one dairy cow, 100 trees, a motorcycle and engaging in a small size businesses. 

David is seeking a loan to venture into poultry farming. The loan amount will be spent on hens. Money generated from milk sales will be used to make initial loan repayments as he awaits for the poultry business to take off. Money generated from eggs, chicks and meat will be used to clear the loan instalments and grow the poultry business. 

His goal is to grow his businesses and diversify the products and services he offers in order to set a firm foundation for his future and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts, gasoline, and maintenance for her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for ten years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts, gasoline, and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 35 years old and has four children.  She is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and to pay for laborers salaries for land preparation.

Merlinda has been farming rice for seven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and to pay for laborers salaries for land preparation

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a 29-year-old woman who is married with two children. She operates a bus to cater to the traveling public. She has three years with this business. Gloria needs a loan to buy tyres, a new coat of paint, and petrol. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Gloria joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tyres, a new coat of paint, and petrol

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert operates a habal-habal( motorcycle transport ) services.  He transports passengers from one place to another. In addition to that, he also engages in running a welding shop. He is 30 year old man with a 2 year old dependent. He needs funds to finance his livelihood.

He is asking for a loan to buy welding materials. These tools are very useful in the operation of his business. With these, he could now slowly recover and be able to expand, using the resources available. He could now be able to settle his obligations and handle his finances.

Robert is determined enough to handle his both sources of income successfully in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy welding materials

loans.name: Tamanno

texts.ru: Таманно 34 летняя женщина. Она замужем и имеет детей. Таманно вместе мужем, свекровью и детьми живет на районе Пяндж. Ее муж занимается животноводством. Таманно 3 года назад решила освоить деятельность отца, мужа и идти по их  стопам. Она сейчас тоже занимается земледелием и выращиванием скота. Таманно очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная  женщина. У нее имеется не большой земельный участок во дворе. В течение 3 года Таманно постоянно сажает урожай. Э том году она посадила хлопок, и на половине части землю хочет посадить урожай кукурузу. И активно готовится к посеву. Таманно на заемные деньги решила купить семена кукуруза и минеральные удобрения. У нее не получилось собрать достаточную сумму денег для купли минеральных удобрений и семена кукуруза, и у нее вся надежда остается на кредит. Поддержите Таманно!
texts.en:
Tamanno is a 34 year old woman. She is married and has children. Tamanno and her husband, mother-in-law and children live together in the Pyandj district. Her husband works in animal husbandry. 

Tamanno decided three years ago to learn the ropes of her father's and husband's occupation and follow in their footsteps. Now, she also works in agriculture and raising cattle.

Tamanno is a very hardworking and goal-oriented woman. She has a small plot of land in the courtyard. Tamanno has been planting crops constantly for three years. This year she planted cotton, and on half of the land she wants to plant crops of corn. She is actively preparing for the planting.

Tamanno has decided to buy corn seeds and mineral fertilisers with the borrowed money. She has not managed to save enough money to buy mineral fertilisers and corn seeds, and she has left all her hope on getting a loan. Please support Tamanno!

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and mineral fertilisers

loans.name: Shohida

texts.en: Shohida is a wise woman. She is 34 years old. She lives with her family in the district of Spitamen. Shohida has over 10 years of experience in animal husbandry and now she wants to start a business of buying and selling cattle to earn income. Shohida would like to support and improve her family life. Her main challenge is lack of money. For this reason she applied for a loan. Shohida needs your support. She believes that with the help of Kiva lenders she will be able to start her new business.

loans.use: To start a business of buying and selling cattle to earn income

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe es un hombre de 43 años de edad, divorciado, tiene 2 hijos independientes de 25 y 23 años, y su negocio es el servicio eléctrico automotriz.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, activo, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Tembladerani’ situada en la  ladera suroeste de la ciudad, debido al terreno en que se asienta, sujeto a la erosión y por tanto de precaria estabilidad, temblaba constantemente, en todo lo largo y lo ancho de la región se deslizan interminables y misteriosos callejones, emergen oscuras tuberías de drenaje y de desague, cual serpientes fabulosas conformando un cuadro más bien raro, como de angustia y desolación, junto a numerosos riachuelos de negruzcas y ominosas aguas que, según se dice, socavan incesantemente la ciudad en lo profundo.
Felipe es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo menor que es independiente, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio eléctrico automotriz,  se especializa en el mantenimiento y reparación de; Generadores, Alternadores, Seguros y vidrios eléctricos, Sistema de luces, y otros, también realiza la  Instalación de accesorios eléctricos como: Luces de Xenón, Salidas de voltaje, Convertidores de voltaje, y otros, “inicié mi actividad hace 20 años, recientemente me independicé y para desarrollar mi negocio necesito herramientas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una vasta experiencia, la desventaja es el costo de las herramientas necesarias para continuar brindando lo servicios. Su sueño es brindar un servicio completo para ampliar su agenda de clientes y consolidar su negocio, él desea realizar la compra de herramientas eléctricas de trabajo para brindar un servicio eléctrico completo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Felipe solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas eléctricas de trabajo, brindar un servicio eléctrico completo y consolidar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felipe is a 43 year old divorced father of two independent, 25 and 23-year-old children.  He works as a car electrician.  He is enterprising, independent, steady, active, patient, responsible and hardworking.  He works in the "Tembladerani" zone located in the south-western region of the city.  Given the type of land that it is own, which is subject to erosion and instability, there are frequent earthquakes. Throughout the region there are endless, mysterious alleys, dark drainage pipes that snake to form a strange painting of anguish and desolation along with numerous black and ominous streams that constantly undermine the city.

Felipe is tan with dark eyes, and short black hair. He is short and of average build.  His native tongue is Aymará, which he speaks with his family, but he also speaks Spanish given the culture as well as the business he works in.  He lives with his youngest son.  They live in a house that they own, made of bricks and cement, with a metal roof and wood floors.  Their house has electricity, running water and sewerage.  He works as an automotive electrician, specializing in maintenance and repair of generators, alternators, power locks and windows, lights, and more.  He also installs electric accessories such as: xenon lights, outlets, voltage convertors, and more.  He states, "I started this career 20 years ago and I recently started my own business. However, to develop my business I need tools." 

The upside of his business is that he has a lot of experience, but the downside is the cost of the tools that he needs to continue providing his services.  His dream is to provide complete services so that he can expand is customer base and strengthen his business.  He hopes to purchase power tools so that he can provide more complete electrical services.  

This is Felipe's first loan with the institution in his two years of working independently in this field.  Felipe is seeking a loan to purchase power tools for his business so that he can provide better service and strengthen his business.

loans.use: purchase power tools, provide electrical service and strengthen his business.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
For 15 years, Estelita has been in the business of operating a sari-sari (variety) store,selling items ranging from soft drinks, beverages and toiletries. She also raises  hogs for an income. She is from Ormoc City, Leyte. Estelita's business is doing well, and she would like to add more piglets and to buy more merchandise to increase her inventory.

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy piglets and feed as well as canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, soft drinks and cooking oil. She is assured that when her store is fully stocked, her customers prefer to buy from her instead of going to other bigger stores. This loan will thus allow Estelita to earn a better revenue.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her variety store as well as piglets and feed.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is from the municipality of Villaba, Leyte. She is married with two sons ages 12 and 16. For three years now, Anecita relies on her business as a fish dealer. This means that she will buy fish from fishermen and sell it to fish vendors in her place.This earned her 3000 PHP per month. She is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP from CEVI to further finance her business. With this loan, she can buy fish in the morning and also in the afternoon, giving boost to her income. The profit will be used for her children's schooling and family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva is 35 years old and married with three children who are in school, Menerva works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, chips, etc.

Menerva has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Menerva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, chips, etc

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.en:
Celedonio is 53 years old, married and has two children. 

Celedonio is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Celedonio requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for his livestock.

Celedonio has been raising livestock for ten years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Celedonio would like to build and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his livestock.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 59 years old and married, and works to help her husband.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business for her food-vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Saturnina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine and her son live in Goris. Her son is an army officer and is rarely at home, so all the work on the farm and household Narine has to do alone. She keeps 11 pigs on her farm. She likes her work, mostly because it provides income for her family's living.
 
To purchase pigs and barley as forage for feeding the pigs, Narine has applied for this loan. This is her second loan. 

Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions previously, was very difficult to return back, and Narine faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her son were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, Narine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and barley as forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past 12 years. She cultivates greens and strawberries on the plot of land near her house. Siranush lives with her husband and their only son lives separately with his family. 

Siranush asks this loan to purchase 25 colonies of bees and start a beekeeping business. She chose beekeeping as it is a profitable business; honey is in high demand. 

This is Siranush's second loan. Unfortunately the first loan, which she got from a local financial institution previously, was very difficult to return back, and Siranush faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her husband were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So Siranush has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for 25 colonies of bees

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor is farmer who lives and works in Jrapi village of Shirak region. He lives there with his wife and two sons.

Grigor's farm is big. He has 20 cows, 20 calves, 40 piglets and hens. In the arable land located near his house, Grigor also cultivates wheat and sells it in the bazaar together with dairy and meat products gathered from the farm.

As Grigor's two sons grow up, the family needs more and more resources to make ends meet. That's why Grigor has applied to lenders for support. All he needs are some financial resources to invest in his farm. He needs to purchase wheat and barley seeds, fertilizer, and fuel needed for land cultivation.

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Grigor's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for wheat and barley seeds, fertilizer, and fuel needed for land cultivation.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is an enterprising smallholder mixed-farmer from the Bungoma area of Kenya who started farming, from scratch, 6 years ago. Presently, his one-acre farm has 4 dairy cows, 5 heads of poultry, 4 sheep, 3 goats and 20 trees. Mark's extra income comes from veterinary services fees that he collects from his clients. 

Most of the income Mark earns is spent on his family's basic needs. His family is made up of him and his wife and 2 children, aged 3 and 6 years.

Mark is seeking a loan to venture into horticultural farming. He plans to use one portion of the loan amount to pay wages for labour and purchase seeds and bags of fertilizer. The other portion will be used to buy a petrol-powered water pump and water pipes to irrigate the farm. 

Your loan will not only help Mark to venture into crop farming but also introduce irrigation farming which will ensure continuous production of crop produce throughout the year.

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming

loans.name: Tangan's Group

texts.en: Tangan’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Tangan makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller by selling ice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. 

Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy rolls of material, a printing board, stencils, brushes, and fabric paint. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, a printing board, stencils, brushes, and fabric paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cash power, a boiler, loaves of bread, butter, and jam.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 23 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells elei printed fabrics to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. 

Annie has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, brushes, stencils, rollers, rolls of material, and gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, brushes, stencils, rollers, rolls of material, and gloves

loans.name: Filipo

texts.en: Filipo is 23 years old and single. He makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Filipo has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, stencils, gloves, brushes, rollers and wooden carved designs. He plans to use his profits to pay for his family's weekly expenses. He joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, stencils, gloves, brushes, rollers and wooden carved designs

loans.name: Gs Los Unidos De Moria Group

texts.es:
El Señor Alexis tiene 39  años de edad, es padre de dos hijos, convive con su compañera de hogar Su finca esta ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Fe de Moria al Oriente de Honduras. Su actividad es la caficultura.
Don Alexis su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con el credito que esta solicitando podra obtener la planta solar esto le ayudara a llevar la energia a su finca y su hogar ya que en su comunidad no hay energia electrica.
Don Alexis ha soñado que tener energia en su hogar ya que esto le significaria progreso desde hace tiempo esta queriendo tener una planta solar para cambiarle la vida a su familia con el apoyo de la Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y Kiva podra cumplir este sueño y mejorar las candiciones de vida de su familia.
Don alexis se ha unido a otros vecinos y amigos para hacer este proyecto ellos son Henry que se dedica  al comercio y tambien cuenta con uan area de café.los demas integrantes se dedican ala caficultura y son  Raul, Elbis, Honan, Avimilet y Marcelino. Todos ellos han soñado con algun dia tener energia en sus hogares.



                                                                             Trojes, Honduras Abril 2015
texts.en:
Alexis is 39 years old, the father of two children, and lives with his wife. His farm is located in Santa Fe de Moria in western Honduras. He has a coffee farm. Alexis dreams of improving the living conditions of his family. He seeks a loan to be able to buy a solar energy unit that will help provide energy to his farm as this would signify progress as he has wanted to have a solar energy unit to change his family's life. With the support of Microfinanciera Prisma of Honduras and Kiva he will be able to make this dream come true and improve his family's living conditions.

Alexis has united with other neighbors and friends to complete this project. They are Henry, who is in business and also has an area of coffee. The other members also grow coffee and are Raul, Elbis, Honan, Avimilet, and Marcelino. They all have dreamed of having solar energy in their homes some day.

Trojes, Honduras April 2015

loans.use: to buy a solar energy unit for his home.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Her name is Rosalia, 45, and she is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronaldo, a government employee, and they have  two children. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her  children to school. 

Rosalia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda, and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their resource to meet their daily expense and to send their children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Rosalia hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life. She strives to hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital,  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Noor. Noor lives in Kudus, located east of Semarang, capital of Central Java, a 9-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Noor is a young guy who has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories for his community. Moreover, his community sees him as a trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Noor is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his communities. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Noor improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Noor is the one who is sitting in his stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Ambar

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Ambar. Ambar lives in Solo, a city located in Central Java, around a 6-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ambar lives there with her husband and her two sons. She owns a stall where she sells mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment service for her community. Her community sees Ambar as a friendly and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Ambar is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits to her communities and bill payment services for her communities. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Ambar improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. Ambar’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her customers via Ruma's latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Ambar is the one who is standing and holding Ruma's banner. She will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ellen is 35 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Ellen has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Ellen has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 52 years old and has seven children. She is married, and one of her children is still in school.

Adelia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Adelia has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Seni

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Seni. 

She owns a stall where she sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits. Seni is a woman who lives with her family in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) south of the national capital, Jakarta. Selvi and her husband have one daughter, and they  started to realize that they are going to need a lot of money to send their daughter to school, that's why Seni decided to join Ruma. 

Seni feels glad because the business she runs gives social impact to her communities. As her business runs, Seni hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more of these mobile services to communities. In the near future, she plans to expand her business to selling Ruma’s Mapan products to her current customers. As seen in the photo, Seni is the one who holds Ruma's poster. She thanks you for kind your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr: Awa qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang au centre, portant un habit jaune, est membre d’un groupe de 26 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sidio au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Awa, âgée de 54 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 21 à 32 ans. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi le fait que l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Awa à exercer cette activité. Awa cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Awa entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Awa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Awa cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Awa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre sa surface cultivée et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Awa espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Awa, who is wearing yellow in the centre of the front row in the picture, is a member of a group of 26 farmers registered by myAgro.  She lives and works in the village of Sidio in the south-east of Bamako, Mali.  Awa is 54 years old and is the mother of six children aged between 21 and 32.  The reason Awa takes part in this activity is the fact that farming is a family tradition, is the main source of income and it allows her to provide food for the home. As well as this, it enables the family to be self-sufficient.  

Awa grows peanuts on her plot but has to cope with farming difficulties such as a lack of rain, farming materials and quality fertiliser.  She begins her first year with myAgro and registered herself because of the payment system and the quality seeds and fertiliser.  This year Awa made some payments to buy a packet of myAgro OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow peanuts so she can increase productivity on her 0.0625 hectare plot.  

Awa grows peanuts for value food production, she explains that peanuts can be eaten directly by the family and used as a base in food sauces.  It is also profitable in terms of production and trading.  She plans to increase the productivity and her profits to expand the fields, and to buy farming materials.  She also hopes to be able to cover her children's tuition fees and ensure the family can provide food for themselves.

loans.use: to buy a packet of OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Это женщина Сафармо. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. У нее двое дочери и один сын. Дочкам 16 и 5 лет. Сыну 8 лет. Мужу 40 лет. Он занимается строительным мастером. Сафармо вместе семьей живет на районе Хамадони. 
Сафармо талантливая женщина. Она 5 лет своей жизни занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. Сафармо любить кроит, и шить женскую одежду, по этой причине она стало портнихой. Ей в работе помогает ее старшая дочка. На данный момент Сафармо надо поменять швейную машинку, потому уже она не рабочем состояния, и прослужила очень долгое время. Новая швейная машинка модели «YAMATA» стоит дорого, чтобы ее купить Сафармо потребуется еще не большое количество денег. Она решила собрать собрать не достающую сумму денег за счет кредита.
texts.en:
This lady is Safarmo. She is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. Her daughters are 16 and 5 years old, and her son is 8. Her husband is 40 years old. He is a construction foreman. Safarmo and her family live in the Hamadoni region.

Safarmo is a talented woman. For the last five years of her life she has been sewing women's clothes in her home. Safarmo loves to cut and sew women's clothes and this is why she became a seamstress. Her eldest daughter helps her in her work. At the moment Safarmo needs to change her sewing machine, because it is not in good working condition and has served for a long time. A new Yamata brand sewing machine is expensive, and Safarmo needs a small additional sum of money to buy it. She has decided to cover the gap in funds with a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new Yamata brand sewing machine.

loans.name: Naringul

texts.en:
Naringul is married and has two children. She has a small area, where she sells daily food products. 

Today Naringul lives with her husband, her taxi driver son and his bride. She has a lovely grandchild. They are living in Fuzuli region, but for 22 years they are an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. 

Today Naringul wants to support her business and therefore she has applied to the Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1900 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy products to support the development of business. She says thanks to Kiva for aid.

loans.use: to buy products , increase business, in the future she want to have her own store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system and a water tank

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavlyuda is a 35 year old wife and mother. She has three children - two sons and a daughter. Her sons are 12 years old and 5 years old, and her daughter is 3 years old. Her husband is 60 years old. Her son and husband work in animal husbandry at home on their farmstead. Mavlyuda herself offers tailoring services. She has been working in this business for three years. She makes a living by means of offering tailoring services.

Mavlyuda wants to renovate her home and improve the living standards for her children and family. However, they do not have enough funds for the renovations. Mavlyuda decided to apply for a loan, and with the loan she will obtain building materials and pay for the services of a professional. Mavlyuda expresses her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for the services of a professional

loans.name: 08 Tân Sơn 1,nam Ngạn Tpth Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liên has a small restaurant selling processed food for breakfast. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to process for sale.

Liên is 41 years old and she is married with two children.

Liên is the group leader of the 08 Tân Sơn 1, nam Ngạn Tpth solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Liên has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Quyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more food to process for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le h pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  desde hace 15 años que se dedica a esa actividad,  su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras para incrementar su negocio y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The young woman with the blurred face is 28 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She has had this business for 15 years, and her business is located near her home. She lives a home with her family. She seeks a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand her business and in this way be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Masrur

texts.en:
Masrur is a hardworking man. He was born in a northwestern part of Tajikistan in 1975. He is living in a rural area with his family. He is married and has three children. He has nine years experience doing business in a domestic market. He sells cell phones and soundtrack accessories. He earns enough money and is satisfied from his activity. 

He wants to continue his work and asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy cell phones and accessories for his store. His business gets him money to ensure his family financially.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories for his store.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol.  She is  a 46 year old married woman with three grown children. She goes fishing and sells fish to the locals in her place as her source of income.  She has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years now. 

She has requested a loan to buy fishing materials, like a fishing net. These tools are essential to augmenting the catch and would enable her to sell more fish. Thus, slowly her income will be back to normal and she will be able to set aside some savings for emergency purposes.

Thus, Analiza would be able to expand her business, continue to improve her livelihood and be more sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like a fishing net

loans.name: Shadya

texts.en:
Shadya is a 38-year-old, married woman with three children.  She was not able to complete her education because of the financial difficulties of her family and she had to work to help her husband with household expenses.  Shadya opened a small beauty salon business, and she is really working hard to provide a good life for her children.

Due to the high cost of living Shadya wants to develop her work, that's why she has requested a loan to buy what she needs including supplies and new equipment for her salon to increase her quality of her work and expand her business  and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy what she needs including supplies and new equipment for her salon to increase her quality of her work and expand her business

loans.name: Nihal

texts.en:
Nihal is a married mother of two girls. She had to leave her job as a cashier after the birth of her second child. She researched what she could do to contribute to her family's income and not just sit at home. On the advice of her sister-in-law, she decided to begin making sweets to celebrate weddings and new births. 

At first, she sold her sweets by piece to a store. Unsatisfied with the money she was earning, she opened a website and began to sell her sweets online. Her sales to both her acquaintances and over the internet have continued. With her second loan she will buy various decorations, magnets, trinkets and other necessary materials for making wedding and baby shower sweets. Her dream is to own her own store.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff.

Nihal hanım evli iki kız çocuğu annesi. Daha önce kasiyer olarak çalıştığı işten ikinci çocuğunun dünyaya gelmesi ile işi bırakmak zorunda kalmış.  Evde boş durmamak eve katkı sağlamak için neler yapabilirim diye araştırmalarda bulunuyor. Görümcesinin önerisi ile nikah ve bebek şekerleri yapmaya karar veriyor. İlk başta başka bir dükkana parça başı çalışıyor. Emeği ucuza gelince internet üzerinden site açıp burada  yaptığı ürünleri sergileyerek satış yapmaya başlıyor. Hem çevresi hem de internet üzerinden satışları devam ediyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile çeşitli süsler, magnetler, biblolar ve nikah ve bebek şekeri için gerekli malzemeler alacak. Hayali kendine ait bir dükkanının olması.

loans.use: to buy various decorations, magnets, trinkets and other necessary materials

loans.name: Nuray

texts.en:
Nuray is single and 20 years old. She lives with her family. She is selling Tupperware products. Since her father began having health problems, she has continued her education online.

She is working to provide for her family but cannot find a long-lasting job. With the recommendation from her neighbor, she started to sell Tupperware products. Since she is just a new starter, she does not make much money and only provides pocket money to keep herself from being a burden to her family.

She will use her loan from Maya to buy more Tupperware products so she can earn more and provide for her family as well. Her dream is to finish high school one day and get a college education.



Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Nuray hanım bekar, yirmi bir yaşında. Ailesi ile yaşıyor. Tupperware ürün satışı yapıyor. Babası rahatsızlanınca eğitimine dışarıdan devam ediyor. Ailesine maddi olarak katkı sağlamak için çalışmak istiyor ama sürekli bir iş bulamıyor. Komşunun tavsiyesi ile altı aydır Tupperware ürünü satmaya başlıyor. Daha yeni başladığı için fazla ürün satamasa da kendi harçlığını kazandığını ve ailesine yük olmadığını söylüyor. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile mutfak eşyaları alacak. İleride ürün satışını daha da artması ile ailesine de yardımcı olacağını düşünüyor. Hayali okulunu bitirip liseden mezun olmak ve üniversite okumak.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware products

loans.name: Hicran

texts.en:
Hicran is married with three children and earns a living by selling Tupperware products. She started this because she faced financial difficulties, which led her to think about what she could do to earn extra money. She saw people around her in this line of work, did online research and got in touch with the regional managers.  After meeting with them she went into this line of work and has been doing it for nine years. Hicran says she makes good money and can provide for her household and her children. With this loan, from she will buy more Tupperware.  She has purchased a car and her goal for the future is to buy a house.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Hicran Hanım evli, üç çocuk annesi Tupperware ürün satışı yapıyor.  Bu işe maddi sıkıntılardan dolayı başlamış.  Ne iş yapabilirim diye düşünürken çevresinde Tupperware satan ve kullananları görüyor.  İnternetten araştırıp bölge temsilcisini buluyor ve onunla irtibata geçiyor.  Bölge temsilcisi ile tanıştıktan sonra bu işi yapmaya başlıyor ve dokuz senedir Tupperware satışı yapıyor.  Çok iyi kazandığını bu işle eşine ve evine katkı sağladığını çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını rahatlıkla karşıladığını söylüyor.  Aldığı kredi ile Tupperware (mutfak eşyaları)ürünü alacak.  Arabasını aldığını şimdi de bir ev almak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware (kitchen products)

loans.name: Handoko

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Handoko. Handoko lives in Lumajang, located approximately 150 km southeast of Surabaya, the capital city of East Java, Indonesia. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive coming to his stall, and he decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business in technology. 

Right now, Handoko is becoming a mobile airtime credits and bill payment services provider for his community. He feels happy because since he is becoming a Ruma's agent, he can give social impact to his community that needs access to such services. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, he needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Handoko’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Handoko is the one who is sitting in his own stall, together with his wife. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a young man who is passionate about fish and aquariums. He identified his passion early and decided to pursue it.

Peter built and sold his first aquarium in 2009, and he has not looked back since. He has successfully sold aquariums to family, friends, and others. Based on his dedication and enthusiasm, today he has more than 15 aquariums that he also services. 

Peter is the first born in a family of three children and was inspired to venture into entrepreneurship by his grandfather, who is a successful entrepreneur. He served as the deputy CEO of his enterprise in high school, where he sharpened his leadership and entrepreneurship skills through the Junior Achievement program. In order to enhance his entrepreneurial skills, Peter gained more skills in aquarium maintenance and construction through apprenticeship.

Peter managed to develop a website for his business from the previous loan he received from KIVA. This has increased his visibility and has increased his customer base. He is receiving more referrals. With this second loan, Peter is looking forward to buying more stock of pet fish and increasing construction of the aquariums.

loans.use: to buy more pet fish and increase the construction and maintenance of the aquariums

loans.name: Marne

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marne works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Marne is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell, for her buy-and-sell coconut wine business.

Marne has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Jeffry Alexander

texts.es:
Jeffry Alexander es un joven estudiante de Arquitectura, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Jeffry Alexander, tengo 18 año de edad, nacional en el Distrito Nacional y me crie en Santo Domingo Este. Soy hijo de padres no videntes, mi madre trabaja como recepcionista y mi pare como empleado en el sector público.
Actualmente estudio en la Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo (UASD) la carrera de Arquitectura, me apasiona la Arquitectura y todo lo relacionado al diseño y construcción de viviendas y lugares. 

A pesar de la condición de mis padres ellos me han ayudado mucho, pero nuestra situación nos amerita solicitar un préstamo estudiantil porque la carrera que curso es muy costosa y aun estudiando en una universidad pública los gastos son demasiados para una familia de escaso recursos como la mía. En caso de que no recibiera este préstamo sería muy difícil para mí y para mis padres, ya que eso implicaría que tendría que dejar de estudiar para trabajar y ayudar a mis padres con los gastos de la casa, además de eso mi meta de ser un gran arquitecto se verían troncada y perdería la oportunidad de poder retribuir todo lo que mis padres han hecho por mí.
Si recibo este préstamo, seria de mucha ayuda, no tendría que preocuparme o preocupar a mis padres con mis gastos, de pasaje, libros, algún material que necesite para mis estudios y así podría seguir cursando mi carrera. 
Una de mis metas es poder tener mi propia compañía de arquitectos, la cual se dedicara a la construcción y reconstrucción de viviendas de personas con discapacidad y de escasos recursos, me siento una persona sumamente bendecida porque a pesar de que mis padres siendo como son, lucha y siguen adelante para que yo sea una gran persona en le mañana y ellos ser mi ejemplo. En mis metas familiares quiero casarme y formal una hermosa familia con 4 hijos.
Una vez que termine mis estudios universitarios, buscarme un trabajo para adquirir un poco de experiencia laboral y luego quisiera irme a Corea de Sur a hacer mi maestría en diseño y reconstrucción de casas y apartamentos. Siempre me ha gustado el diseño y la reconstrucción de viviendas y pienso que ese será el campo de trabajo en el cual espero trabajar.
texts.en:
Jeffry Alexander is a young architecture student. He asks for a loan to be able to cover his educational expenses. This is his story:

My name is Jeffy Alexander. I am 18 years old. I was born in the Distrito Nacional and was raised in Santo Domingo Este. I am the son of parents who are visually impaired, my mother works as a receptionist and my father works as an employee in the public sector.

Currently, I am a student at the University Autónoma de Santo Domingo (UASD), with a major in architecture. I am passionate about architecture and everything related to the design and construction of homes and places.  

Despite my parents' condition, they have helped me a lot. But our situation merits us asking for a student loan because the degree I am studying for is very expensive and even with studying at a public university, the expenses are too much for a family with limited resources like mine. If I don't get this loan, it will be very difficult for me and for my parents because this will mean that I would have to stop studying to work and help my parents with the household expenses. In addition, my goal to be a great architect would be truncated and I would lose the opportunity to repay all that my parents have done for me. 

If I get this loan, it would be a great help. I wouldn't have to worry or make my parents worry about my expenses for transportation, books, some materials I need for my studies, and I could continue studying for my degree. 

One of my goals is to be able to have my own architecture company, which will work in construction and reconstruction of homes for people who have disabilities and limited resources. I feel I am an extremely blessed person because despite my parents being as they are, they struggle and get ahead so that I can be a great person in the future and they are my example. In my family goals, I want to get married and have a lovely family with four children. 

Once I finish my university studies, I will look for work to get a little work experience and then I would like to go to South Korea to get my masters degree in design and reconstruction of houses and apartments. I have always liked design and reconstruction of homes and I think that this will be the work field where I hope to work. .

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Josefa Marina

texts.es:
Con mucha energía, inicia a trabajar día a día, Josefa, una mujer de cuarenta y siete años de edad, que inicio su negocio comprando ropa por unidad en tiendas de ropa usada para venderlas en su vecindario, con sus ganancias fue invirtiendo en comprar cada vez más piezas, hasta que llego a poner en su casa una pequeña tienda donde oferta a sus clientes ropa, zapatos, joyas, perfumes y lencería. 
Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado aumentar y prosperar notablemente, es por eso que ella no quiere detener su crecimiento y ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita invertir más y comprar joyería y unas cajas con ropa y zapatos usados para surtir su negocio en esta temporada. En un futuro desea poder mejorar la infraestructura de su local he incursionar en la venta de juguetes para niños. Su mayor objetivo aparte de hacer de su negocio algo grande, es poder acompañar en sus estudios universitarios a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
With a lot of energy and work day after day, 47 year old Josefa began her business buying pieces of clothing in used clothing stores to then sell in her neighborhood. With the earnings she would buy more pieces of clothing until she eventually opened a small store in her home where she sells clothing, shoes, jewelry, perfume, and lingerie. With the passage of time she has been able to grow and prosper quite well. She doesn't want to stop growing her business and she has approached Kiva and MiCredito for a loan that will enable her to buy more jewelry and some boxes of used clothing and shoes in order to stock her business this season.

In the future she wishes to be able to improve her store's infrastructure and expand to sell children's toys. Her main goal in addition to expanding her business, is to be able to accompany her two children in their university studies.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and some boxes of used clothing and shoes to stock her business for the season.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is not only a kind-hearted man, but also very well-organized, industrious, and entrepreneurial. He is 21 years of age, hardworking, and energetic. He hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that is blessed with good climatic conditions and favorable weather patterns that favor farming. 

Leonard was raised in a humble family and he never got the opportunity to go to college because of a lack of money to pay tuition fees. As a result of this, he never received any formal employment, and yet never surrender to that. He started farming and, through farming, he has been able to take care of his parents and siblings. 

Leonard's sources of income are vegetables, milk, and eggs. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Kapsowar area has bad terrain, a poor road network, and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. 

This is why Leonard is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Using a motorbike, he will be able to deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

Leonard is very determined to succeed and, because he is very disciplined with finances, he expects that with his accumulated profits, he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents. 

Leonard's dream is to go back to school, and he hopes that, through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his farm products to market.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 46 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É avicultora a mais de 7 onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo ração, pintos e vitaminas. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende abrir uma barraca na sua nova residência de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade e erguer novas capoeiras.
texts.en:
Elisa comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. She's 46 years old and single. She has two underage children who are in school. She's not responsible for anyone else.
She has been a poultry farmer for over seven years and spends her earnings on household expenses. She's requesting a loan so she can increase turnover in her chicken breeding business by purchasing feed, chicks and vitamins. This is her 6th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future she intends to open a stall at her house for selling household staples. She also intends to build new poultry houses.

loans.use: to purchase feed, chicks and vitamins.

loans.name: Francis Minerva

texts.es:
La señora  Francis de 44  años de edad, tiene un hijo que depende de ella, vive en casa propia en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años la venta de abarrotería en su negocio.
Doña Francis es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como ser churros, frescos, quesos, lácteos, jabón, carnes, pollo, azúcar, café. etc.  Con el apoyo del crédito pretende mejorar  sus ingresos y así desea obtener mejores ganancias, su sueño es mejorar su negocio este es su segundo crédito que solicita.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015
texts.en:
Francis is 44 years old, has one child dependent on her, and lives in her own home in a village in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has made a living for 10 years operating a grocery store business. Francis in a hard-working woman who desires to come out ahead. She also relies on the support of her husband. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of churros, soda, cheeses, dairy, ham, beef, chicken, sugar, etc..for her business. With the assistance from this loan she intends to increase her revenue and obtain greater profits. Her dream is to improve her business. This is the second loan she has requested.

loans.use: for the purchase of churros, soda, cheeses, dairy, ham, beef, chicken, sugar, etc..for her business

loans.name: Las Rebeldes Group

texts.es:
Las comunidades oaxaqueñas tienen costumbres demasiado arraigadas, un claro ejemplo es el día de muertos en el cual los habitantes, ataviados de sus trajes típicos, ofrendan bailes y platillos únicos de la región. Dentro de esta cocina se encuentran el mole negro y rojo, las tlayudas (tostada tradicional), los chapulines asados y chiles rellenos, entre otros. 
   En dicho municipio se formó un grupo llamado Las Rebeldes; las integrantes luchan por sus ideales, por su actividad y principalmente por su familia, ellas son: María De Jesús quien vende postres; Paulina, frutas y verduras; María Irene, ropa y calzado; Alicia, calzado; Gelasia, ropa; María, comida. Por su parte, Perla maneja una carpintería y Ma. Jazmín una tienda de abarrotes.
   Al ser madre soltera María Irene también tuvo que desempeñar el papel del padre por lo que desde hace veintidós años inició con la venta de calzado y ropa. “Comencé sólo con cinco mil pesos, compré ropa y sandalias; vendía afuera de mi casa pues no tenía un lugar fijo”. Hoy en día Irene tiene un pequeño local heredado por su padre el cual está ubicado en el centro de la comunidad. 
   Con las ganancias obtenidas sus hijos continuaron estudiando y pudo solventar los gastos corrientes del hogar. Actualmente vive sola y las ganancias las utiliza para cubrir gastos personales e invertir en más mercancía. La estabilidad de su negocio se debe al extenso surtido de calzado y ropa, a la facilidad de pagos y al trato amable que ofrece a cada uno de sus clientes.
   Esta vez el préstamo lo invertirá en sandalias, huaraches, blusas, playeras y shorts, mercancía con mayor demanda. “En la tienda invierto la mayor parte de mi tiempo, tengo ganancias, me distraigo, me siento útil y libre pues no dependo de nadie” comenta sonriente Irene.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el local de Doña Irene quien viste blusa negra con rayas color gris.
texts.en:
Oaxacan communities have very deep-rooted customs, a clear example of this is the Day of the Dead, in which the people, dressed in their typical costumes, offer dances and unique regional dishes. Inside of the kitchen you can find black and red mole, the tlayudas (traditional toasts), roasted grasshopper and stuffed pepper, among other things.

In this municipality, a group called Las Rebeldes [The Rebels] was formed; the members fight for their ideals, for their businesses and above all for their families. They are: María de Jesus, who sells desserts; Paulina, who sells fruits and vegetables; María Irene, who sells clothing and shoes; Alicia, who sells shoes; Gelasia, who sells clothing; and María, who sells food. For her part, Perla manages a carpentry shop and Ma. Jazmín a grocery store.

Being a single mother, María Irene also has to play the role of father, so 22 years ago she started a business selling shoes and clothing. "I started with only 5,000 pesos, bought clothing and sandals, and I would sell outside of my home because I did not have a fixed location." Today, Irene has a small shop inherited from her father, which is located in the center of the community.

With her earnings, her children continued studying and she was able to settle her current household expenses. Currently, she lives alone and uses the profits to cover personal expenses and invest in more merchandise. The stability of her business is due to the extensive assortment of shoes and clothing, the ease of payments and the friendly treatment that she offers to each one of her customers. 

This time, she will invest the loan in sandals, huarache shoes, blouses, t-shirts and shorts, merchandise with the most demand. "In the store, I invest the majority of my time, I get distracted, I feel useful and free and I don't depend on anyone" Irene commented, smiling.

 *The photograph was taken in Doña Irene's shop, who is wearing a black blouse with gray stripes.

loans.use: to buy sandals, huarache shoes, blouses, t-shirts and shorts.

loans.name: Joel Mauricio

texts.es: Joel de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 3 años, también trabaja como jornal, con sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de leche, granos básicos, huevos, refrescos, café, etc. para aumentar su mercadería y así aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Joel is 37 years old. He lives in his own house with his family. For the past 3 years, he has owned a small store. He also works as a day laborer. With his sales, he is able to cover some household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy milk, basic grains, eggs, beverages, coffee, etc. in order to increase his merchandise and, that way, to boost his sales and his earnings.

loans.use: to buy milk, basic grains, eggs, beverages, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Alma Rose

texts.en:
Alma Rose is 44 years old and married with one child.

Alma Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, etc.

Alma Rose has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from her water refilling station.

Alma Rose aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and bread

loans.name: Ma. Jasmin

texts.en:
Ma. Jasmine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a personal care products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of personal care products to resell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening. 

Ma. Jasmine dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal care products to resell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Beatriz works hard to support her family.

She has a candle-making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling native hats. Beatriz is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her candle-making business.
