Therefore, Khatoon has requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to generate maximum profit in this tenure.

loans.use: to buy wood for her husband's firewood stall for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, cereals, flour, vegetables, cooking oil and kitchen utensils for use in the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm tools for her farming activity to get a better harvest for client and family needs.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
To help her husband earn a living, Rosie has been into operating a small variety store (commonly known as sari-sari store in the Philippines) for five years now. She is married to Jesus, and they are blessed with two children. Jesus is working as a driver, and their summed up income meets the daily expenses of their family. 

Ever since, Rosie has wanted to expand her business. For this reason, she would like a loan worth PHP 20,000. She will use this loan to buy additional supplies of merchandise and products like grocery items, toiletries and beverages. With this loan, she can be able to sell more products, enabling her to increase her profit. 

If given a chance someday, Rosie wishes to have her own stall and get a successful life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of merchandise and products like grocery items, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more dried maize to sell to enable him to meet the supply demands of his customers and make more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers so as to increase soil fertility for a better agricultural produce to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds for planting to enable a good harvest for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Agnes is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending business.

Agnes dreams that she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Tania Osiris

texts.es:
Tania tiene 46 años de edad, casada y es madre de dos pequeños varones,posee un negocio de lácteos totalmente familiar junto a su esposo, quien mucho tiempo estuvo apoyándole desde lejos para que ella y sus hijos pudieran salir adelante.
Estudió su secundaria y obtuvo el título de perito mercantil y contador público, actualmente esta cursando la carrera de Psicología Empresarial, iniciando su carrera en el 2008 pero debido a la situación económica tuvo que retirarse por 3 años, apoyando a la educación de sus pequeños hijos, el poder superarse como profesional se tornó difícil pero no imposible, es por eso que esta decidida a culminar sus estudios con mucho sacrificio ya que esto le brindará mejores oportunidades laborales en su empresa.
Sus metas están orientadas al éxito y lo logrará con sus cualidades mas destacadas como ser la perseverancia, superación propia y la humildad ante cualquier situación.
Mediante su preparación educativa, Tania desea servir a la sociedad mediante su carrera profesional ya que le permitirá aplicar muchos conocimientos de crecimiento empresarial y a la vez servirá de motivación y esfuerzo a sus hijos.
La joven menciona lo difícil que ha sido su vida como profesional, ya que cuando se encontraba estudiando, su esposo se quedó sin empleo y ella también, se vieron obligados a formar su propio negocio el cual generaba lo necesario para la educación de sus hijos, pero Dios le dio esa oportunidad que tanto anhelaba un empleo y las condiciones han mejorado, es por eso que esta dispuesta a no rendirse y obtener su grado como licenciada en psicología.
texts.en:
Tania is 46 years old, married and mother to two small boys. She has a family dairy business with her husband who much of the time supported her from a distance so that she and their children could get ahead.

She finished high school and obtained the title of chartered accountant and public accountant. Currently, she is studying Business Pyschology, beginning her course in 2008 but, due to the economic situation, she had to suspend it for three years to support her small children's education. The power to get ahead as a professional became difficult but not impossible. It is for this that she decided to finish her education with a lot of sacrifice since this will provide better working opportunities in her business.

Her goals are geared toward success and she will achieve this with her most outstanding qualities such as perseverance, self improvement and humility in the face of any situation. Through her education, Tania wishes to serve society with career since it will allow her to apply many skills for business growth and, at the same time, will provide motivation and effort to her children.

The young woman mentions the difficulty she's had in her life as a professional since when she was studying her husband was left without work, as well as herself. They felt obligated to create their own business which generates what they need for their children's education. But God gave her this opportunity that she wished for and the conditions have improved. It is for this that she is committed to not give up and to obtain her degree as a licensed psychologist.

loans.use: to finish her psychology studies.

loans.name: Cruz Piedad

texts.es: Piedad tiene 48 años de edad, ella creció en el campo y para obtener los ingresos económicos se dedica a la agricultura y al jornal de trabajos de agricultura. Piedad es separada de su esposo asi que Piedad vive con sus 4 hijos que son mayores de edad. Piedad se dedica desde hace 30 años atrás a la siembra de productos que se dan en la tierra donde ella reside. Piedad solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar fungicidas, abono, pagar del arriendo del terreno en el que siembra. Piedad comenta que de la agricultura es de lo que vive y ha sacado  adelante a sus hijos y que así lo seguirá haciendo para a futuro comprarse una casita.
texts.en: Piedad is 48 years old. She grew up in the countryside and in order to obtain economic income, she has dedicated herself to farming and the wages of farm labor. Piedad is separated from her husband so she lives with her four children who are adults. Piedad has been dedicated for thirty years to planting products that are found on the land where she lives. She is requesting the money from the loan to buy fungicides, fertilizer, and to pay to rent the land where she plants. Piedad says farming is what lives and has gotten her children ahead and she will keep doing it to buy a little house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Medea

texts.en:
Medea is 62 years old. She has two sons and both are married. Medea is unemployed and she wants to start a business. Her sons have their income, but Medea wants to have her own salary. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,100 USD. She will open a cafe and will have her own income. She already has space for a cafe in her yard. Her town of Batumi is very popular with tourists, especially in summer as it is at the Black Sea. She thinks that she will have a good number of clients and will have her own income.

loans.use: to open a cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his business to increase his income so as to improve hi family's living standards.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is 55 years old and supports a family of 5 family members. She has been practicing farming for the last 25 years earning an income of KES 11,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to improve her farming activity through use of modern farming technology. This will increase her income and improve her family's health care. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to raise a relatively higher income regularly.

loans.use: To improve her farming activity through use of modern farming technology so as to raise her income and improve her family's health care.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза, 21 год, замужем, есть сын. У нее средне-специальное медицинское образование, работает медсестрой в городском роддоме, на сегодняшний день - в декретном отпуске и занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью дополнительным доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Дилнозы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 40 овец. На 1,50 Га арендованной земли выращивает кукурузу и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). Дилноза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец, кур, часть средств направит на полеводство. Доходы от кредита позволят Дилнозе развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Dilnoza is 21 and married with one son. She has a specialist secondary education in medicine and works as a nurse in the city maternity hospital. She is currently on maternity leave and working in farming as well to bring in additional income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has 40 sheep on her farm as well as 1.5 hectares of land where she grows corn and clover for sale. Her monthly income is about 16,000 KGS.

Dilnoza has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase sheep and chickens and for land cultivation costs. Profits from the loan will allow her to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some sheep and chickens and to cultivate her land in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 54-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three sons and two daughters. 

Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 25 years. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Fatima is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Fatima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Amanda Yadira

texts.es: Amanda es una joven alegre, vive con su madre y sus 4 hermanos, Amanda a sus 19 años de edad se dedica al jornal de trabajos de agricultura y también a medias con su madre siembra  pequeños huertos de alverja, frejol, tomate de árbol y otros productos. Amanda solicita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de abono y fungicidas para curar sus cultivos y hacer que estén sanos y en el momento de la cosecha obtener buenos productos. Amanda tiene su aspiración de seguir trabajando en la agricultura y salir adelante aunque ya no le alcance los recursos económicos para seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Amanda is a cheerful young woman. She lives with her mother and four brothers. At 19 years of age, she works for agriculture wages. With her mother, they plant small gardens with peas, beans, tree tomatoes and other products. 

Amanda requests a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and fungicides to treat her crops. She wants to keep her crops healthy and to harvest good products. Amanda aspires to continue working in agriculture and succeed even though she will not reach the financial resources to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her husband's cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Jorge Anibal

texts.es: A sus 50 años de edad Anibal tiene su esposa que es jornalera y una hija de 14 años y asiste al colegio. Anibal vive en el campo y se dedica a sembrar huertos de alverja, y demás productos de que se dan en el lugar de su residencia. Anibal es un señor muy trabajador que solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar lo necesario para sus cultivos asi como abono, fungicidas para que engrose sus productos  y no se entre los insectos y larvas. Anibal tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando en la agricultura y espera obtener buenas cosechas y que el precio de los productos este alto. Anibal espera a un tiempo corto lograr formar un capital para comprar una casa ya que en la actualidad vive arrendando.
texts.en: At 50 years of age, Anibal has a wife who is a laborer and a 14 year old daughter who attends high school. Anival lives in the countryside and is dedicated to planting peas and also products found in his place of residence. Anibal is a very hard working man who is requesting the money from the loan to buy what is needed for his crops such as fertilizer and fungicides so his products get big and insects and larvae do not enter. Anibal aspires to keep working in farming and hopes to obtain good harvests and that the price of the products is high. Anibal hopes in a short time to have capital to buy a house since he currently rents.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is 40 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son and two daughters are in school. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 8 years. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the house hold. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to resell, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Hina is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to assist her husband with purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. This way her husband can increase the size of his business and earn a better profit. 
Hina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his cloth bsuiness

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 33 and she is living with her five children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been selling fruits and vegetables for many years. He uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling. As a hawker, he can easily travel near to the people. The people like to buy fruits at their doors instead of going to the market. Due to the fruits' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased and by noon he has run out of stock.

Shamim feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for the family. She is receiving a loan for her husband so that he can buy fruits in more quantity. 

Shamim wants to save the excess profit so that she can use these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fruits in more quantity for reselling by her husband.

loans.name: Al Tadamon 14044 Group

texts.en:
Feryal is the featured borrower for Al Tadamon 14044 Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and their living at the same time.

Feryal is a 58-year-old married mother of five children. She started 12 years ago selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children.

Feryal is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes for the summer season. Feryal is the first lady on the left of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Ghada is a 54-year-old married woman who wants to buy a car. Nadia is a 55-year-old married mother of one child who has a grocery shop and wants to increase her merchandise with new products. Ronzi is 26-year-old married mother of one child who sells make up and wants to buy new make up items. Ghada is the second lady on the right, Nadia is the second lady on the left, and Ronzi is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen de 22 años de edad inició su activida comercial desde el año 2011, cuando laborando en una empresa se le ocurrió vender mercancias a crédito  a  sus compañeros de trabajo, con el fin de ampliar sus ingresos. Como madre de una niña de 2 años,  con una gran responsabilidad en su sostenimiento  y el logro de bienestar para toda su vida, decidió trabajar con esmero impulsada por este propósito. Hoy genera 2 ingresos uno mediante su trabajo directo en una empresa y el otro como comerciante de diversos productos que vende aun, entre sus compañeros de trabajos y referídos por estos, con el fin de lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo y  educar a su hija con posibildiades de éxito y esto es justamente su motor y gran desafio de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestuario, ropa interior, y perfumería; con este crédito  mejorará su negocio,  pues aumentará su oferta y con ello el incremento de sus ventas, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Karen, age 22, started her commercial activity in the year 2011.  When she was working for a company, it occurred to her to sell merchandise on credit to her work colleagues in order to increase her income.  As the mother of a two year old daughter, with great responsibility to support her, and the achievement of well-being all of her life, she decided to work hard driven by this intention.

Now she generates two incomes.  One is through her work at a company, and the other is by still selling diverse products to her work colleagues and to those referred by them.  She does this in order to manage to increase her working capital and to raise her daughter with the opportunities for success.  This is exactly what drives her and her great challenge in life.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, underwear, and perfume.  With this loan her business will improve.  She will increase her inventory, and with that her sales will increase.  This will make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes, underwear, and perfume.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 29-year-old single man, living in Kanyakine, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Like many smallholder farmers in Kenya, he owns a tiny inherited plot of land to live off of, just under half an acre, and has always struggled to support his family. His primary sources of income have been milk, poultry, crops and some small personal business he engages in to supplement his meager income. James passionately loves dairy farming, but one challenge he has been facing is lack of water for home consumption and irrigating his farm. Most of the rainwater goes to waste and therefore James is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a water tank and water pipes. With the water tank and water pipes, he will be able to harvest and store rainwater in the tank. This loan will be of much help because James will not be walking for long distances in search of this precious commodity. The tank will assist him in irrigating his farm, hence increasing productivity and income levels. All that James waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy water pipes and a water tank.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old single man from Qalqilya city. He has worked as a farmer for the past few years. 

Mohammad now wants to buy his own land and start planting it after taking good experience in this field. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a small piece land and also some seedlings to start his own business. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be more independent and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a small piece of land and also some seedlings to start his own business.

loans.name: Sofia Paola

texts.es: Paola es una señora perseverante, ella es una mujer viuda que vive con sus 2 hijas gemelas  de 4 años que están estudiando, Paola comenta que hace 3 años atrás su esposo tuvo un accidente y falleció, ella lucho duro y saco adelante a sus hijas que tenían un año, Paola se dedicaba  a la venta ambulante de ropa,  colchones, electrodomésticos y otros productos. Paola en la actualidad ya pudo arrendar un cuarto donde ofrece sus productos. ella cuenta que empezó en este negocio cuando nuestra institución le dio el primer crédito, Paola va a invertir el dinero en la compra de mercadería en electrodomésticos, ropa, colchones y mas para ampliar su negocio y seguir trabajando, de este negocio Paola aspira mejorar su negocio para beneficio de sus hijas.
texts.en: Paola is a perseverant woman. She is a widow who lives with her twin daughters who are four and in school. Paola tells us that three years ago her husband had an accident and passed away. She fought hard and pulled along her daughters who were only one years old. Paola is dedicated to selling clothing, mattresses, appliances and other products on foot. Paola currently could rent a room from which to offer her products.  She says that she started this business when our institution gave her the first loan. Paola is going to invest the money in the purchase of merchandise such as appliances, clothing, mattresses and more to expand her business and to keep working. Paola aspires to improve her business for the benefit of her children.

loans.use: to buy mattresses and appliances.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis, 23 years old, supports three family members. He has been operating a hotel business for the last three years, earning an income of KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to improve his business by offering quality foods to meet client's needs and to earn more income so as to improve family living standards. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan as well as educate his children. His hope is to raise relatively higher income regularly.

loans.use: to improve his business by offering quality foods to meet client's needs and to earn more income so as to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to service his special hire vehicle.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José de 43 años de edad, se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos especialmente comidas rápidas y bebidas. Su negocio inició desde hace 2 años, cuando en el año 2012 hizo un curso a través del Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje SENA, organización de educación técnica administrada por el Gobierno Nacional, para impulsar el desarrollo productivo y competitivo en los niveles técnicos y tecnologicos en Colombia. Su idea de negocio la proyectó  cuando estuvo estudiando y en el año 2013 la consolidó mediante el mosntaje de su restaurante de comidas rápidas. José permanece en su punto de ventas ubicada en el barrio donde habita; allí  se encuentra todos los dias desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza a proveedores del mercado público, para ofrecerle a sus clientes que son sus vecinos y transeuntes, precios competitivos. Su meta es lograr tener un restaurante con mas opciones y muy bien organizado y con un concepto de servicio muy amplio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos alimentarios y 9 mesas plásticas, con el fin de ampliar la variedad de sus productos e incrementar la capaicdad de atención a su clientela, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Jose, 43 years old, works in the preparation and sale of food, especially fast food and drinks. He started his business 2 years ago when he took a course in 2012 through SENA (Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje), a technical education organization administered by the federal government. SENA promotes productive and competitive development on technical and technological levels in Colombia. 

He made his business plan when he was studying and in 2013 he strengthened it by setting up his fast-food restaurant. 

Jose remains at his point of sale, located in the neighborhood when he lives; it is there that he can be found everyday from 9 o’clock in the morning until 10 o’clock at night. He makes his purchases from vendors in the public market, to offer competitive prices to his customers who are his neighbors and passers-by.

His goal is to manage to have his own restaurant, very well organized, with more options and with a broad concept of customer service. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has requested from Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, he will purchase food supplies and 9 plastic tables to expand the variety of his products and increase his ability to attend to his customers, making the investment of his Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies and 9 plastic tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm inputs to improve farming activity for better produce for sale in the market and to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes that this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell to be able to support her family.

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Cristóbal es un hombre de ahora 30 años de edad, él está muy agradecido por los créditos a los que ha tenido acceso porque gracias a ello él ha logrado superarse día con día, ahora su negocio de venta de dulces artesanales le deja muy buena ganancias, y gracias a esta superación él ahora ha construido un dormitorio para sus hijos. Pero Cristóbal ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para poder construir otro cuarto, aunque lamentablemente él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus materiales de construcción como  arena, block, hierro y cemento.
El gran sueño de Cristóbal es seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia para que ellos ya no sufran de carencias.
texts.en: Cristóbal is 30 year old man now. He is very grateful for the loans to which he has had access as thanks to them he has been able to improve day by day. Now his business of selling artisan candies gives him very good profits and thanks to this improvement he has built a bedroom for his children. But Cristóbal has made the decision to request a new loan to be able to construct another room. Unfortunately he does not have sufficient money to buy the construction materials like sand, cinder block, re-bar and cement. Cristóbal"s big dream is to continue to improve the living conditions of his family so that they don't lack anything.

loans.use: to buy sand, cinder blocks, re-bar and cement.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre que trabaja día con día para labrar la tierra y de ella sacar provecho para el sustento de su amada familia, él  cuenta que está muy bendecido porque gracias al crédito anterior el logro comprar sus fertilizantes y obtuvo muy buena cosecha de maíz. También cuenta que ahora las condiciones de vida de su familia han mejorado, pero Diego con el deseo de superación ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder realizar la remodelación del techo de su casa comprando materiales como laminas y madera.
El gran sueño de Diego es seguir mejorando su vivienda para darle a su familia un mejor hogar.
texts.en: Diego is a man who works from day to day in the fields and takes advantage of this to provide the sustenance for his beloved family. He says that he is very blessed as thanks to the last loan he managed to buy fertilizer and got a very good harvest of corn. He also says that the living conditions of his family have improved. But Diego with the desire to improve has made the decision to request another loan to be able to undertake the remodeling of the roof of his house buying materials like laminate sheeting and wood. Diego's big dream is to continue to improve his house to give his family a better home.

loans.use: buy laminate sheeting and wood to remodel the roof of his house.

loans.name: Yalmer Donaldo

texts.es:
Yalmer es un pequeño caficultor con 37 años de edad, que vive en la zona norte del país. Siempre ha sido un padre y esposo comprometido con su familia, quien dice lo motivan cada día para esforzarse en su trabajo y soñar con un mejor futuro.

En su pequeña finca cuenta con aproximadamente 2 hectáreas de café cultivado, para el cual está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita asegurar la compra y aplicación de insumos agrícolas que requiere para asegurar una mejor cosecha y mayores ingresos en este ciclo.

Para este productor, la mayor herencia que puede dejar a sus hijos, es el amor al trabajo y a la caficultura, el cual ha sido un cultivo al que su familia por diferentes generaciones se ha dedicado, y que él ahora maneja bajo criterios de certificación como comercio justo.
texts.en:
Yalmer is a small coffee producer who is 37 years old and lives in the northern area of the country. He has always been a committed father and husband to his family and he says they motivate him every day to work hard in his job and to dream of a better future.

On his small farm, he has approximately 2 hectares of cultivated coffee for which he is requesting a loan which will allow for the purchase and application of farming inputs he needs to assure a better harvest and greater income in this cycle.

For this producer, the greatest inheritance that he could leave his children is the love of work and coffee farming which has been a crop to which his family, for different generations, has been dedicated and that he now runs under the criteria of fair trade certification.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to apply to his coffee to get a good harvest.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 36 year-old married mother of two. She started almost a year ago working as an accountant in a supermarket to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. 
Rose is an ambitious lady, hard worker, and sacrificing mother who is trying hard to satisfy her family's needs. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. This loan is very important to Rose, for she believes that education is a priority and it will guarantee her children's future. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Los Claveles 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Claveles 2 está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas ellas gracias al trabajo que ellas hacen van mejorando poco a poco.
La Sra.  Susana una de ellas solicita este préstamo para la compra de variedad y más cantidad de materiales  para la elaboración de los comestibles comercializados, que ella misma hace y que sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una persona muy trabajadora que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y con ello poder dar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Claveles 2 Group is in it's second cycle with the women's committee program. They are part of the program for the elimination of poverty where, thanks to the work they are doing, they are all improving little by little. 

One member, Mrs. Susana, is requesting this loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of ingredients for the preparation of commercial foodstuffs which she will make and sell on the street herself. She is a very hard worker who gives 100% so she can grow and get ahead. 

She is grateful for the opportunity to be able to improve the conditions she lives in and, in turn, give the her family the best.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to have more milk to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Moheeb

texts.en:
Moheeb is a 26-year-old single man from Qaqlila city. He has worked as a farmer for the past few years. Moheeb now wants to buy his own land and start planting it since he has good experience in this field.
 
Moheeb took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a small amount of land and also some seedlings to start his own business. By taking this loan, Moheeb will be more independent and improve his living conditions. 

Moheeb appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a small amount of land and also some seedlings to start his own business.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 48-year-old married mother of three children. Four years ago, she opened a fruits and vegetables shop to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children.

Wafaa is a hard worker and an ambitious lady, who is well known in her region and has a good reputation among her customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business and increase her merchandise with summer fruits and vegetables to satisfy her customers' needs.

Wafaa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with summer fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity through the application of modern farming technologies for more income so as to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming activity through the adoption of modern farming technologies for more income to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 67 years old and widowed with eleven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Carolina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Carolina has been raising pigs for thirty years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small piece of land and some seedlings to start his own business.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, de 46 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, vive junto a su familia en su casa de habitación y se dedica desde hace varios años a comercializar leche de vaca y también se dedica a la venta de pescado vivo.

Ana, tiene más de doce años de estar trabajando con productos lácteos y hoy planea vender queso fresco como producto derivado de la leche que vende a diario.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más leche para elaborar el queso fresco y de esa manera fortalecer su negocio de lácteos, ya que en el invierno la demanda crece considerablemente. 

Ana, sueña con seguir con su negocio de lácteos y ayudar a sus hijos a superarse.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old, is in a relationship and has 3 children. She lives together with her family in their house and for a number of years has worked selling cow's milk and also works selling live fish.

Ana has more than 12 years working with dairy products and now she plans to sell fresh cheese as a product derived from the milk she sells daily. She needs the loan to buy more milk to make the cheese and in this way strengthen her dairy business as demand in the winter increases considerably. Ana dreams of continuing her dairy business and help her children to better themselves.

loans.use: to buy more milk to make fresh cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in galvanized steel sheets, wood, gravel, sand, cement, and a toilet to construct a bathroom and a water tank.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 19-year-old single man from a village near Tulkarem city. He has been working as a farmer for the past few years. Ibrahim now wants to buy his own land and start planting it after having gotten good experience in this field. 

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a small plot of land and also some seedlings to start his own business. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be more independent and improve his living conditions. 

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a small plot of land and also some seedlings to start his own business.

loans.name: Sin Bandera Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨Sin Bandera¨. Con el fin de seguir adelante con sus negocios y seguir aportando en los gastos económicos del hogar, solicitan por cuarta vez crédito ADIM y a los inversionistas de KIVA. 
El coordinador del grupo es José Esteban, 42 años, acompañado  y responsable de 4 hijos de edades de 12,11,7 y 2 años, se dedica a la venta de leña y es agricultor desde hace 5 años, y comercializa en su comunidad con la ayudad de su esposa, quien también vende los productos. Invertirá en la compra de árboles pequeños y arboles grandes, para sacar mayor productos y aumentar las ganancias.
Las demás integrantes son: Justa, 52 años, y se dedica a la venta de derivados de maíz en su comunidad, e invertirá en la compra de maíz y leña. Y Norma, 27 años, quien en su casa elabora tortillas, y comprara maíz y leña
texts.en:
This group is called Sin Banderas ("Without a Flag"). In order to get on with their business and continue contributing to home expenses, they are requesting their fourth loan with Kiva investors through partner ADIM.

The coordinator of the group is José Esteban, who is 42 years old, married, and responsible for four children ages 12, 11, 7 and 2. He has worked in agriculture and selling firewood for 5 years. He advertises in his commmunity with the help of his spouse, who also sells the products. He will invest in the purchase of big and small trees to make better products and increase profits.

The other group members are: Justa, 52 years old, who sells corn derivatives in their community and who will invest in the purchase of corn and firewood; and Norma, 27 years old, who makes tortillas in her home and who will buy corn and firewood.

loans.use: buy big trees and small trees.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah, 38 years old, is married to James and supports four family members. She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 15 years, earning an income of KES 13,000 per month. 

Lydiah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family health care. 

Her hope is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
This borrower's name is Florencia. She is 55 years old, married, and with five grown children. She lives in Getafe, Bohol with her family. 

Florencia is engaged in multiple businesses. She sells coconut wine, locally known as tuba. She also rents out a videoke machine for events and uses her tricycle for her transportation business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more coconut wine and pay for the repair of her tricycle. Her earnings allow her to cover healthy meals for her family and pay for basic household expenses like water and electricity.

In the future, she hopes to make her businesses more successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine for resale and pay for the repair of her tricycle (three-wheeled transport)

loans.name: Moussa's Group

texts.fr: Moussa qui se trouve sur la photo est assis au premier rang  et porte un vetement rouge, il est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sirakoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Moussa, âgé de 66 ans, est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 12 à 44 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, ont incité Moussa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Moussa cultive le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Moussa entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Moussa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de mais afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Moussa cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Moussa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Moussa espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Moussa, who is seated in the first row wearing a red shirt in the photo, belongs to a group of 12 farmers who have signed up with myAgro. They all live and work in the village of Sirakoro to the southeast of Bamako in Mali. Moussa, 66 years old, has seven children ranging from 12 to 44 years of age, six of whom are currently in school. Following the family tradition, Moussa has been doing farm work for some 50 years. Farming is his main source of revenue as well as source of food for the household. Moussa grows corn on hi is field. His challenges are low rainfall as well as lack of farm supplies and quality fertilizers. 

Moussa is starting his first year with myAgro. He signed up because of the possibility to buy quality seeds and fertilizers on an installment plan. This year Moussa is making payments to buy a pack of myAgro OPV [Open Pollinated Variety] seeds and fertilizers to increase his yield of corn a field of 0.0625 ha [0.15 acres]. Moussa has been growing corn for 40 years already due to its nutritional properties and commercial value as he sells corn at the market. With the increase of his yield and his revenues, Moussa plans to start raising livestock and also to buy farm supplies. Finally, Moussa hopes to be able to cover school fees for his children and ensure that his household always has a sufficient food supply.

loans.use: to buy a pack of OPV seeds and fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of cosmetics and beauty products such as body lotions, hair shampoo and hair clips to sell to her customers to generate more income.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 57 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus dos hijos que aún estudian, ella trabaja sola ya que su esposo falleció hace un tiempo y ella tuvo que asumir el rol de padre y cabeza del hogar.

Susana, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, pero ha visto la oportunidad de colocar una tienda en su colonia, ya que ahí no hay nadie que tenga tienda de granos básicos y productos de primera necesidad.

Susana, desea el préstamo para comprar pan, vegetales, azúcar, arroz, frijol, detergentes, entre otros productos para poder poner la tienda.

Ella, espera que su negocio sea rentable y de esa manera salir adelante con sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Susana is a 57 year old widow who lives with her two children who are still studying. She works alone as her husband passed away some time ago and she had to assume the role of father and head of family. Susana works keeping the house but sees the opportunity to put a store in her neighborhood as nobody has a store selling basic grains and primary food items. Susana wants the loan to buy bread, vegetables, sugar, rice, beans and detergent amongst others to open the store. She hopes that her business will be profitable and in this way get ahead with her children and have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy bread, vegetables, sugar, rice, beans and detergent amongst others to open a store.

loans.name: Sinath

texts.en:
Sinath is 32 years old, a married factory worker with an only child in her care. She resides in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been a worker in a factory since 2005, earning around $7 per day. Her husband is 33 years old, and he also works as a factory worker, earning approximately $6 each day. 

Now Sinath would like to request a loan to buy bricks and cement to build a ground-floor room. With this loan, she will be able to have additional space for living. In the future, she wants to save money to renovate her house and support her child in earning a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to build a ground-floor room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming activity through adoption of modern farming technologies.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras pasan al décimo quinto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Isidra, quien es una persona muy entusiasta, que quiere salir adelante por medio de sus esfuerzos y su trabajo. Ella quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia por medio del programa de comité de mujeres.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras Committee is in its fifteenth cycle with the women’s committee program, where all are putting in their best effort to be able to grow and succeed.

One of the members is Isidra, who is a very enthusiastic person who wants to succeed through her effort and her work. She wants to be able to improve her and her family’s living conditions through the women’s committee program.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase a variety of articles of clothing to allow her to continue with her work the way she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and improve every day.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is a farmer living in the village of Goghovit in the Shirak region. He lives there with his wife and three children (two sons and daughter, 22, 19 and 11 years old respectively). Gagik always knew he wanted to become a farmer. He earns his family's living by operating a farming business in Goghovit. 

His daughter is a student in Economic University in the town of Gyumri. Because their village is located far from Gyumri, Gagik's wife, daughter and little son live in Gyumri so their daughter is able to get university education. Gagik and his elder son live in the village and are occupied in agriculture. 

They keep livestock including cows, calves, sheep and hens and also cultivate wheat and large variety of fruit trees (apricot, cherry, plum, pear and walnut). He asks for this loan to purchase 15 piglets, forage for the livestock, and fertilizer to develop the farming business and earn income for the family. 

Because the region where Gagik's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate there is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Gagik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for 15 piglets, forage for the livestock, and fertilizer to develop the farming business and earn income for the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add labor to increase the stock of bricks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old, married, and blessed with 4 children. She is a farmer and has been growing cash crops for selling for 18 years now. 

She will be using this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm, and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her future hopes are to expand her farming by growing more varieties of cash crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his business activities through the proper servicing and maintenance of his motorcycles.

loans.name: Sahaludin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Sahaludin, one of Ruma’s agents. Sahaludin lives in North Bogor, an area in West Java located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. Together with his wife, they have one cute child. 

Sahaludin owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He has already been with Ruma for almost a year; he knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. Sahaludin is a friendly and kind person. His community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Sahaludin is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sahaludin improves his business and, accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

Sahaludin's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce service to his community. As seen in the photo, Sahaludin is the one who is sitting. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Grupo Unido, son jóvenes que se unieron para poder aportar al menos con un pequeño ingreso por medio de su sacrificio y esfuerzo. Ellos vieron una gran oportunidad en este programa de comité de jóvenes.
Francisco es vendedor de frutas, comenta que hace sus ventas de manera ambulante, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar un poquito a su familia y a sus seres queridos. 
El pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is called Grupo Unido. They are youths who have come together to be able to provide at least a small income from their sacrifice and effort. They saw a great opportunity in this youth committee program.

Francisco is a fruit seller. He comments that he makes his sales on foot, and through his sales he has the means to be able to help his family and loved ones a little.

He is requesting this loan to be able to purchase fresh fruit and with it be able to continue with his work in the way he has been doing it.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his business by offering quality foods to meet clients' needs and to earn more income so as to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Davlatmurod

texts.en:
Davlatmurod is 29 years old and provides for a family of three members. He lives in the district of Hamadoni. In Hamadoni, the majority people are engaged in farming. Davlatmurod has been practicing farming for the last eight years. Thus he feeds his family. 

Davlatmurod works very hard, because without this kind of activity they do not have any source of income. Now he should plant a new crop, but unfortunately he does not have enough money. Life is very difficult for them. For this reason, Davlatmurod applied for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel. Davlatmurod really needs your generosity.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, 54 years old, is married to Rebecca and supports five family members. 

He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 20 years, earning an income of KES 15,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild the house

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella lives in Gyulibulagh village which is located in Shirak region. She is occupied in land cultivation and also keeps two cows. Ella lives with her mother-in-law, husband and 18-year-old daughter. Ella's husband works in construction and that's why Ella is the only one who takes care of the family farm. She works hard to gather good income and help her husband with covering family's daily costs. 

Ella needs this loan to purchase potato seeds, fuel and fertilizer needed for land cultivation. Because the region where Ella's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate there is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Ella's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fuel and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Insherah

texts.en:
Insherah is a 26-years-old single lady from Jericho city. She lives with her family in a very poor house. Insherah is a student in a local university. she also has a store for selling cosmetics and makeup. It is a good business and provide her with a good income to cover her studing costs and also some of her family expenses.
Insherah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her cosmetics store. by taking this loan, Insherah will be able to improve her business and also her family living conditions. 
Insherah appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products for her cosmetics store which pays for her university tuition fees

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 48-year-old married mother of two sons and three daughters and lives in a village near Jenin city. Her husband is a construction worker earning a very low income. Fatmeh works as a farmer growing olive trees on the family's agricultural land. Fatmeh took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm, increasing farm productivity and her family's income. 
Fatmeh appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy feed, fodder, grass and hay for his dairy cows to produce more milk to sell.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is a farmer living in Malarik town in the Shirak region. He is 50 years old and a big part of his life has been running a farm. Kamo  is engaged both in cattle breeding and wheat cultivation. 
He currently keeps cows, calves and hens. Kamo purchases little calves and pigs, feeds them and then sells them at a higher price. 
Because Kamo is a skilled and experienced farmer, agribusiness enables him to earn income and support his family. Kamo lives with his wife and two daughters who are 23 and 3 years old. 
By applying for this loan, Kamo asks lenders to help him purchase eight sheep and wheat seed to develop the farm and make it more profitable. 
Because the region where Kamo's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate there is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Kamo's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for eight sheep and wheat seed to develop the farm and make it more profitable

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine is from Aragats village where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and two school age children. This family's only occupation is in farming business. More specifically, they cultivate haricot, potato, cabbage, cucumber and some greens. Qristine's husband sells the gathered harvest in local markets and this is how family's income is formed. The family, got involved in pig breeding as well and as for start they now keep two piglets.
 
Qristine asks this loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase  fertilizer and 320 wires needed for the greenhouse renovation. This loan will be a big support for family's farming business, as they want to bring the greenhouse to working condition and enlarge cultivation of seasonal crops. 
 As this is Qristine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Qristine get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. The family hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and 320 wires needed for her greenhouse renovation for a better vegetable harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm; he hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and be able to educate his children.

loans.name: Gulpari

texts.en: Gulpari is a sociable and polite woman. She is 37 years old and lives with her four children in the district of Hamadoni. Her husband works in Russia as a migrant worker. For women, it is difficult to live without their husbands raising children. Gulpari is amazing woman. She works from morning till 2 a.m. At the moment, she has not received any assistance from her husband in Russia. Gulpari wants to buy an embroidery sewing machine and increase her business. If she purchases an embroidery sewing machine, her work will be easier and she would improve her living conditions. Then she would be able to spend more time supporting the education of her children. Her main problem is lack of finances. Gulpari hopes for support and believes in you.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery sewing machine and increase her business

loans.name: Fare'

texts.en:
Fare' is 29 years old, single with no kids, and lives near Jenin city. His mother, Turkieh lives with him in the same house. Fare' has a small stockade in front of his house, and he uses it to trade with livestock, such as goats, sheep, horses etc. 

Fare' needs the loan to buy sheep in order to raise them and sell them on the Adha Eid, as it is a tradition in Palestine that Islamic people sacrifice sheep for religious reasons. 

Fare' faces two main challenges, the first one is the lack of liquidity, and that limits his ability to expand with his project and buy more livestock, the other challenge is the seasonality of his project.
For the future, Fare' hopes to expand his project as it is the main source of income to him and to his mother, and by expanding his project his profits will increase and then he will get the chance to get married and have a family.

loans.use: to buy more sheep, which will be sold later for traditional local holidays

loans.name: La Mu Chaung Village

texts.en:
The featured borrower of this group, Than, is 32 years old and married with a three-year-old son. He is a happy, proud father, and he enjoys his job as a farmer. Also, Than has many expectations for his son and one of them is for him to be a well-educated man in the future. As he needs a huge amount of capital before harvest season, Proximity's loan will help him regulate his cash flows. Than has a three-acre crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar. With the funds, he will purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and petrol for farming machines. These inputs are vital for his crop farm to increase its yield. Pictured above (from left to right) are Than, Moe, Aung, Myint and Aung M.

These Community Based Organization leaders oversee a group of 13. The funds will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. La Mu Chaung Village’s main focus is crop farming, and seasonal plantations such as betel trees and banana trees.

loans.use: To rent farm equipment and to purchase crop seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem  is 50 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

Shameem also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000  to purchase more animals to grow her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to grow her sales.

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes lives in Aygabats village of Shirak region with his beloved family: his wife, son, daughter-in-law and 4-year-old granddaughter.  

To sustain his family's living, Artashes is involved in a farming business. He cultivates land and keeps livestock. Artashes's wife helps him to get dairy products both for family use and for selling. 

To be able to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer needed for the development of the farm, Artashes has now applied for this loan. Because the region where Artashe's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate there is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. 

Artashes's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer needed for the development of the farm

loans.name: Kin Chaung Wa Village

texts.en:
Featured Borrower, Kyin is 40 years old, single and living with her sister. She has seven years experience in both farming and teaching in the village. Even there are many challenges, she enjoys working in the farm and proud of it. Kyin, has three acre crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season. The loan will help her purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. These inputs are vital for her crop farming to increase yield. She is very kind-hearted that she is donating the money to the monastery in memory of passed away parents. She will as well support financials to her nephew to become a monk.

The fund will help 12 members and supervised by CBO leaders of the Kin Chaung Wa Village. Pictured above (from left to right) are Kyin, Tun, Kyaw and Aye.

The fund will help the group, purchase farming essentials before harvest time.  Kin Chaung Wa Village’s mainly focus on crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantation such as betel, coconut and banana trees.

loans.use: To rent farm equipment and to hire farm workers during harvest time.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
18 son las personas que integran este grupo llamado ROSA MISTICA el cual está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien se dedica al trabajo de venta de comestibles, es una persona muy trabajadora que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, que es cuando se levanta a hacer las ricas comida que ella misma después vende. Comenta que se hizo de muchos clientes gracias a las delicias que hace.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, pollo, condimentos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir haciendo las comidas para poder vender. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
18 people make up this group called "Rosa Mistica", which is in its eighth loan cycle of the women's communal bank program, where everyone works and helps one another to succeed. One of the members is Maria, who sells food.  

She is a very hard-working person who works everyday from a very early hour, which is when she gets up to make delicious meals that she herself later sells. She says that she's gotten a lot of customers thanks to the delicious meals she makes. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments and other ingredients and thereby continue making meals to sell. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more electronics for sale in the market for more gain

loans.name: Japhter

texts.en:
Japhter is 26 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for four years now. He will be using the loan to buy dairy feed, napier grass, hay and fodder for his dairy cows. He hopes this will enable him to get more milk for sell. 

Japhter plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his dairy farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed, napier grass, hay and fodder for his dairy cows and hopes this will enable him to get more milk for sell.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena  is a 50-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Haseena ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. 

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Haseena  has requested a 50,000 PKR loan to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Zahoor

texts.en: Zahoor is a 54-year-old, vigorous mother of three children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Zahoor’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She will gain more profit and plans to fulfill her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 32-year-old man from Jabalia City. He is married and a father of three sons and one little daughter.

Muhammad was living with his family in a small, humble house, but during the latest violence in Gaza his house was destroyed completely, so he had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently, Muhammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Muhammad to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life. Muhammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his old house

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is 36 years old, married and has three children. She lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. Liana has a vocational education with her specialty of accounting. She got married at a young age and became a skilled farmer along with her husband. On her farm, Liana has cows, a calf, a bull and chickens. Liana’s farm is especially focused on poultry. From her farm, she sells milk, macun (national dairy-product) and also a lot of poultry and eggs. All her farm products are also very useful for her family and for her school-aged children. Now Liana especially wants to enlarge the assortment of dairy products for sale. With great hope of being supported she asks for this loan to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her all farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her all farm cattle

loans.name: Olivia De Jesus

texts.es:
Olivia es una caficultora que vive en una pequeña comunidad del norte de Nicaragua. Vive con sus 3 hijos en su finca, la cual es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. En los últimos años, ella ha logrado una producción de 260 quintales de café pergamino. 

El emprendedurismo es una característica de Olivia, lo cual le ha permitido ir mejorando los rendimientos y calidad de su cafetal, que es una de sus principales metas, por lo que para este ciclo, ella está solicitando un crédito que le permita mejorar la nutrición de sus cafetos para tener mejores resultados en cuanto a calidad y rendimiento.

Su sueño es ir mejorando las condiciones de su parcela y continuar invirtiendo en este rubro, el cual dice que tiene un gran potencial económico para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Olivia is a coffee grower. She lives with her three children in her farm, in a small community in the north of Nicaragua.

Her farm is their main source of income. In recent years, Olivia has produced 260 quintals of Pergamino (Parchment) coffee.

Olivia is an entrepreneurial woman. This characteristic has allowed her to gradually improve the yield and quality of her coffee plantation, which are two of her main goals. 

For this cycle, she is requesting a loan with which she will be able to improve the nutrition of her coffee plantation so that she can have better results in terms of yield and quality.

Her dreams are to gradually improve the conditions of her plot of land and to keep on investing in growing coffee. She says that this occupation has a great economic potential to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic and inorganic fertilizers for her coffee plantation to guarantee better yields and quality.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia is a 44-year-old married mother of five children. Zakia is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet customer orders on time to earn a good amount of profit. This monetary help can bring Zakia closer to her dream of providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet customer orders on time to earn a good amount of profit..

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Akhuryan village with her husband and two sons. Agribusiness is the only source of income that helps this family to earn its living. 
Svetlana, together with her sons and husband, keeps livestock of cows, calves and hens and also cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. Realizing how important it is for the family to be prepared for coming harvesting season and having sufficient income, Svetlana has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her with purchasing  potato seeds and fertilizer. 

Because the region where Svetlana's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate there is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Svetlana's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer to enlarge the potato cultivation and gather more income

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 40-year-old mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession selling apples, bananas, grapes, etc.. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.
Safia's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit to resell. Her husband wants to increase his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial conditions, her husband is unable to purchase fruit for his business.
Therefore, Safia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will help her husband to purchase fruit for his business. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his fruit business

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 41 years.  She is a married woman, who lives with her two children in the village of Matkhoji. Her husband lives abroad and transfers some money to satisfy the family's basic needs. Tamar finds it hard to tackle the financial difficulties and make a good living condition for her children. She is unemployed and doesn't have any source of income for herself. As there is a high unemployment rate in the region and she is unable to start any stable job, she decided to be involved in her own business.  She requested a loan for it's starting. According to above mentioned situation, Tamar lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 1500 GEL and start her trading business.  She will purchase stock of various kinds of clothing and linens.  

Tamar thinks that the business will be profitable as she will work on private orders and also have her own customers. The family will have a stable income which will enables them to cover everyday costs and have better living conditions.  With the support of the Start Up program, Tamar will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties

loans.use: To trade with clothing and linens

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Married and a father of two boys and a girl, Hamza lives in a Palestinian Camp located in North Lebanon, Hamzah works as carpenter (doors, windows and furniture). He is 36 years old and has been married for almost 10 years. His kids are respectively 5, 7 and 9 years old. 
In order to expand his work and create new opportunities, Hamzah is asking for a 1,543,992 Lebanese Pound loan for the first time from Kiva field partner Ibdaa to buy new and more developed carpenter tools which will decrease his working time and efforts and increase his profits. Hamzah has 20 years of experience in the field and aims at perfection in his work. He is an active guy, a caring husband and father and very successful in his work.

loans.use: to buy new carpenter tools

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Owner of a goods shop and working in the wholesale of some products for smaller shops since 2014, Mahmoud is a 28 year old Palestinian refugee living with his family in the Palestinian camp located in the North of Lebanon. 
He is currently engaged and planning on starting his own family soon. 
Mahmoud is asking for a 2,569,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva field partner Ibdaa to buy new products and goods for his shop. Getting the loan will allow Mahmoud to expand his activity in the wholesale field and help him increase his income. His shop is located in a very popular area. He is an ambitious, successful and active young man who is always working on maintaining his good reputation in the market.

loans.use: to buy new goods

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en: Tehmina is a married woman. For some years, her husband (also shown in the photo) has been running a food stall business selling "pakoras," a dish consisting of vegetable pieces and chicken dipped in a gram flour or besan. He is expert in making good tasting pakoras and earns enough through this business to contribute to the family income. To increase his sales, he needs to purchase gram flour with packs of oil, salt and spices. For this reason, Tehmina has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000 for her husband. She is positive that her husband’s business will flourish in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase gram flour with packs of oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.en:
This is Rajabali. He is 26 years old and married and he has a daughter. Rajabali lives with his wife, his daughter, and his parents in the district of Hamadoni. 

His wife and mother are housewives, and Rajabali and his father provide for their family. His father is a gardener. Rajabali is a taxi driver. He has been engaging in this activity for three years. 

Now his car needs repair, but Rajabali does not have enough money. For this reason, he applied for a loan, hoping that with lenders' goodness and support he will be able to repair his car and expand his business. 

In the future, Rajabali wants to use the profits from his activity to buy another car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his farming through application of modern farming technology

loans.name: Sabastian

texts.en: Sabastian is a 43 year-old married man with six children.  They live in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of a butcher shop and also grows bananas to supplement his income.
