He faces challenges of inadequate capital that hinders the progress of his business. His business dream is opening up new outlets in the nearby markets. Sabastian has asked for a loan to buy a cow for slaughtering so that he can sell it.

loans.use: to buy a cow for slaughtering

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia  is 33 years old.  She is a married woman who has three children. The man shown in the photo is her husband who has been running a business selling fruits for many years. He is very enthusiastic in his work and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support his family. For the improvement of her husband's business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently.  That will ultimately enable him to cover their utility bills timely.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas for her husband's business

loans.name: Noshaad

texts.en: Noshaad is a 43 year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly and her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore. Noshaad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Noshaad is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 19-years-old single man from Dier El balah city.  His father works as an employee in the public sector.  He gets a very low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. Husam opened a grocery store in the city to help his family  to cover part of their expenses. 

Husam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store to resell. This will improve his business and also his income. 
Husam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his store.

loans.name: Termine

texts.en:
Termine was born in this village of Zovaber of the Gegharkunik region, and today she still lives here with her family. She has two school-aged sons. Her husband is a builder and also a good farmer. Their farm is very small and has only a cow and a calf.  Termine provides only her family members with fresh and tasty dairy products . Instead, on her plot of land, she cultivates a lot of potatoes which she manages to sell with good profit to regular re-sellers from the city. 

With this Kiva loan Termine greatly wants to buy potato seedlings of high quality, fertilizer, and also fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings of high quality, fertilizer and also fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for sale in the market

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 40-year-old married man from Rafah city. 

He works as an employee in the public sector. He gets a very low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. Mohammad opened a grocery store in the city to help his family to cover part of their expenses. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products to sell in his store. This will improve his business and also his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the school season and with these revenues she hopes to give a better lifestyle to her two daughters.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy firewood that she will use to bake her charcoal stoves

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
This young lady is 21 years old. Her name is Ani. She is married and she has two sons. Ani is a fragile woman but at the same time she is very strong and laborious about her farm work. With her small children and her house to take care of she also manages farming and agricultural activities in Geghamavan village of the Gegharkunik region. Sometimes she does all these alone since her husband regularly goes to work abroad.

Little by little she has developed poultry on her farm and now she already has 50 chickens and she sells a lot of eggs and poultry. Ani also has cows and a calf. Like many families in this region she cultivates and sells potatoes to re-sellers. As she says, she is happy with her farm work and hopes that it will be so profitable for her young family that her husband can stop going so far to earn more money for his family. With this loan amount of 400,000 Armenian drams she wants to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and also some fodder for her cattle on the farm.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and also some fodder for her cattle on the farm.

loans.name: Kisakye Group Kirinya Bweyogerere

texts.en:
Betty is a first time borrower in Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. who was insipired by her fellow members in the group to come and borrow money. She is a married mother with children.

She sells matookes (green plantains) both wholesale and retail. She has applied for for a loan of 500,000 to boost her business.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to the group. They are hard working and honest people who have dreams of earning big after they have grown their businesses through the financial boost.

loans.use: to buy more matooke to add in business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 58 years old, married and the mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the trainings especially on enterprise development and financial management.

She practices mixed farming and also operates a green grocer store. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables so as to add stock to her green grocer store for increased income and to meet customers needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to add stock to her green grocer shop for increased income and to meet customers needs.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is 51 years old and lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region with her husband who works as a driver and her son. For some time Alina worked at the bread factory as a baker and now she already has her own trading business. Alina sells a great and nice assortment of men's, women's and children's clothes. She rents a stall for her business and she is a very clever and patient businesswoman who has no lack of customers.

Alina needs quickly to refresh her stall’s assortment with a new spring-summer clothes collection for which she has not enough money. With this Kiva loan she will buy new seasonal clothes to sell. She mentions that her first deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon will be her start for a coming new partnership.

loans.use: to buy new seasonal clothes to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is married and has three children, none of whom attend school because they are grown-ups. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers shop. She faces a major challenge from fluctuations in her number of clients. As a result, goods perish, leading to losses.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase a stock of goods, like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding the business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods, like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feeds to boost her business

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard and her big family are involved in agribusiness. Alvard, her three sons, daughter-in-law, two grandchildren and husband live and work in Sevqar village of Tavush region. Her husband is a construction worker. Her eldest son is a laborer working in the forest. Her middle son sells meat in a local market. Alvard, her third son and daughter-in-law run the family's farm near their house. They keep livestock of eight cows, eight sheep, a pig and seven piglets. They also cultivate wheat, corn, and potato to sell in local markets. 

Alvard has applied for this loan to ask lenders for support with their farming operations. She plans to purchase two oxen, six piglets, and forage for feeding the livestock. She also plans to renovate the barn for pigs.
 
As this is Alvard's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Alvard get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Alvard and her family hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, six piglets, forage for feeding the livestock, and renovations to the barn for pigs

loans.name: Wikurie Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mercy, a member of Wikurie Self Help Group. She is 49 years old, married and a mother of five children.
Mercy joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014. She has benefited from HiH EA training on enterprise management where she was able to acquire skills related to prudent financial management. This has enabled her to maximize profits.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy feeds that will help boost milk production and thus meet the demand of customers. This will lead to more income in order to meet her family's basic needs. 

Mercy is thankful to Kiva and their lenders for their assistance and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds that will boost milk production and thus meet the rising demand of customers.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is 34 years old. She is married, her husband works as a taxi driver, and they have 5 children.  She attends to a grocery store, sells food, and works at her house. Sandra needs a loan to buy ice cream for her store.  Across from her house, there is a school, and she thinks she has the opportunity to increase her income by selling ice cream to the students.  Sandra would like to have her own house in the future because she pays rent.

loans.use: to buy ice cream for her business.

loans.name: Madlena

texts.en:
Madlena is from Aygehovit village where she is involved in farming activities. Her family is hardworking. Her husband works as a seller in the village, her son is a laborer working in the forest and Madlena together with her mother-in-law runs the family farm. The farm includes 22 hens and a large variety of vegetable and fruit cultivation. Madlena sells the gathered harvest (corn, haricots, potatoes, onions, garlic and grass and apple and pear trees).

This is Madlena's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from a local financial institution, was very difficult to pay back, and Madlena faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her recent hard work, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So Madlena has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a pig and forage (15 packages) needed for the farm.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Benard. Benard is 57 years of age, married and blessed with eight children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and underwent training on enterprise management. 
 	
He runs a butcher shop selling beef to earn a living. He would like to expand his business by adding more stock of beef. However, he is constrained financially, requiring him to borrow money to meet his business expansion goal. He looks forward to a rise in sales and thus more income to cater to his family's needs.

Benard is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of beef and thus meet the rising demand of customers.

loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en:
Fikrat is a taxi driver. He is married with two children. They have been IDPs (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city for 22 years and now live in Fuzuli region, near the war zone. This zone makes the conditions of life very difficult.

This is Fikrat's second loan. The first loan he closed on time. It was noted that Fikrat is a taxi driver. Today he wants to buy a new wheels. For this reason Fikrat needs 700 AZN.

For this help he is thankful to Komak and the Kiva organization. In the future he wants to change his car and to help his children in their education.

loans.use: to buy new wheels and increase business; in the future he wants to change his car and to help his children in education.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, a 61-year-old married man who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, used his previous loan to buy cocoa to sell to his customers. Being the sole provider, he works hard to ensure that his family will enjoy a better standard of living.

Francis mainly grows cocoa for sale and also hires cocoa gardens to harvest and sell supplementing it from what he gets from his gardens, but unfavorable weather conditions and insufficient funds limit his expected returns. He has a desire to expand his cocoa business to greater heights and is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.es:
Jeremías es un hombre de 52 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 26 y 31 años de los cuales todos ya está casados, esta humilde familia  vive en una comunidad de  San Andrés Semetabaj.
Jeremías con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace dos años, pero para obtener mejores ingresos también se dedica al cultivo de frijol y maíz. 
Jeremías ahora tiene la necesidad de comprar un lote de terreno donde él pueda incrementar un poco más su cultivo, pues hasta este momento él cuenta con poco terreno, pero una de las dificultades que Jeremías tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprarlo por tal motivo solicita el prestamo, para poder cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Jeremías es comprar más terrenos  para incrementar  su cultivo y de esa forma ya no pagar  arrendamientos.
texts.en:
Jeremías is a 52-year-old man who is married and has a beautiful family. He has three children, who are between the ages of 26 and 31, and all of them are married. This humble family lives in a community of San Andrés Semetabaj.

With the desire to generate an income and to support his family, Jeremías began working in masonry two years ago. In order to make additional money, he also grows beans and corn for a living.

Now, Jeremías needs to buy a plot of land where he can increase his crop a little more, because he currently has a small piece of land. One of the difficulties he faces is that he does not have enough money to buy the land, which is why he is requesting the loan so he can meet this need.

His biggest dream is to buy more land to increase his crop, so he does not have to rent the land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for cultivation.

loans.name: Luís Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 50 años de edad, está casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos.- Luis, no solo es agricultor, también trabaja como empleado en un empresa privada de distribución eléctrica desde hace más de 15 años, su hijo menor está siguiendo sus pasos, al igual que su otro hijo que se dedica a la venta de pan en motocicleta.

Luis, percibe dos diferentes tipos de ingresos, la agricultura la aprendió de su padre, pero en estos días solo con lo que gana de la cosecha de maíz y de frijoles, no alcanza para darle una buena vida a su familia.

Luis, necesita el dinero para comprar abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes para sembrar una parcela de maíz.

Luis, sabe que dentro de poco se jubilara, pero aun así dice que nunca va a dejar de trabajar en el campo mientras esté vivo.
texts.en:
Luis, 50 years old, is married and lives with his wife and three children. Luis is not only a farmer but has also worked as an employee at a private electrical distribution business for more than 15 years. His youngest son is following in his footsteps, just as his other son sells bread via motorcycle.

Luis has two different types of income. The farming he learned from his father, but these days he can't provide his family with a good life with just what he earns from the corn and bean harvest.

Luis needs the money to buy manure, pesticides, and fertilizers in order to grow corn on a plot of land.

Luis knows that he will retire soon, but even so he says that he will never stop working the land while he is alive.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, and fertilizers in order to plant corn on a plot of land

loans.name: Kiambari Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Faith, 36 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 with an aspiration to be trained and to be able to gain economic and social power.

She is borrowing a loan for the second time. She used her first loan to top up her savings to buy a calf. Her main purpose for applying for this Kiva loan is to buy animal feed and add one more calf to her flock. This will in return help improve milk productivity and thus provide more income for her family.

Faith is grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a calf  that will help boost milk productivity.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Servicio de fotocopiajes, lava seco, miscelánea y papelería, son los negocios, que desde hace 10 años, tiene Johanna, mujer de 38 años, que habita en la ciudad de Bogotá con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad. Johanna necesita comprar mercancía en un mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos y hacer ofertas competitivas que exhibirá al surtir su negocio, haciendo uso de su capacidad creativa para impulsar la venta desde su punto comercial. Su principal mercado son los estudiantes y sus vecinos, quienes compran todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, mediante el sistema de contado. Su meta es lograr un buen surtido y finalmente impactar sus ventas para proporcionar una educación de calidad a su hijo;  su mayor desafío es lograr cumplir sus obligaciones financieras y mantener a su clientela atraída por su servicio y en esto se enfoca día a día. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará útiles escolares y comprará una vitrina, con esta inversión planea mejorar sus utilidades, comprando más mercancía y así mismo vendiendo mucho más.
texts.en:
38 year-old Johanna has had a business doing photocopy and dry cleaning services as well as selling stationary and miscellany for ten years. She lives in the city of Bogota with her spouse and small six year-old son. Johanna needs to buy merchandise in high volume in order to get discounts and make competitive offers for the stock she'll exhibit in her shop, making use of her creative abilities in order to boost sales in her business. 

Her main market is students and their neighbors, who shop everyday from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. on a cash system. Her goal is to attain a good selection of goods, leading to an increase in her sales in order to offer quality education to her son. Her greatest challenges, which she is focusing on day by day, are to meet her financial obligations and to maintain her clientele, who were attracted by her services. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to purchase school supplies and a display case. With this investment, she plans to improve her profits by purchasing more merchandise, and thus selling much more.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and a display case.

loans.name: Magdalena Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 21 años, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos en Santo Domingo, una ciudad que se dedica mucho al comercio y la producción agrícola y ganadera, está ubicada en la región Costa de Ecuador.
Ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropa, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, Carolina viaja a otras ciudades a comprar la mercadería ya que consigue buena ropa y con mayor descuento; su esposo también trabaja, él compra y vende mariscos en el mercado. Esta pareja de esposos han trabajado mucho y se han podido superar gracias al apoyo de los créditos para los microempresarios.
Carolina trabajó ya con un crédito, quedó muy bien, fue cumplida con los pagos, el mismo que lo invirtió en mercadería, gracias a las ganancias obtenidas puedo abrir otro negocio, actualmente cuenta con un pequeño salón de belleza donde realiza manicure y cortes de cabello, es muy visitada por clientela del sector, realiza u buen trabajo.
Ahora solicitan un crédito para incrementar mercadería en ropa interior, medias y blusas porque es una temporada muy buena y desean aprovecharla para seguir creciendo como microempresarios para el futuro poder ya contar con su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carolina is 21 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Santo Domingo, a city with a lot of business activity as well as farming and ranching. It is located in the Costa [Coast] region of Ecuador.

She has sold clothing for several years. She learned this business from her mother. Carolina travels to other cities to buy the merchandise, since she obtains good clothing and a better discount. Her husband also works. He buys and sells seafood in the market. This couple has worked hard and has been able to overcome thanks to the support of the loans for microbusinesspeople.

Carolina has already worked with a loan; it went very well and she made her payments on time. She invested it in merchandise. Thanks to the profits obtained, she can open another business. Currently she has a small beauty salon where she does manicures and haircuts. It is frequently visited by customers from the area. She does a good job.

Now she is asking for a loan in order to increase her merchandise in the form of underwear, stockings, and blouses, because it is a very good season and she wants to take advantage of it in order to continue growing as microbusinesspeople and in the future have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and merchandise.

loans.name: Mujeres Diamantes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Diamantes está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, ellas tienen la esperanza de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Andrea, miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, que vende de manera ambulante, y con ello se gana la vida de una manera digna. Comenta que se ha hecho de muchos clientes y que quiere poder seguir creciendo  y esforzándose.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Diamantes" is in its first loan cycle with the women's committee program. All the members work together and help each other to get ahead. They hope to grow their businesses and improve their living conditions and those of their families.

Andrea is a member of this group. She works as a street vendor selling various types of clothing. This is how she earns a living in a dignified manner. She mentions that she has many customers and that she wants to keep on growing her business and working hard.

She is requesting this loan to buy different types of clothing to sell such as jeans, shirts, pants, and other items. With this purchase, she will be able to continue with her sales.

She is grateful for this opportunity, which will allow her to grow her business and better herself.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, pants, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Sector Martinez Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Sector Martínez¨, integrandos por 4 personas con diferentes negocios pero con un solo fin engrandecer sus negocios. Provenientes de la zona rural de Granada. Están solicitando a ADIM por quinta vez, un crédito para la compra y suministros para sus respectivos negocios. 
El líder del grupo es Jonathan, de 25 años, casado y con 1 hijo de 6 años. Se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado en el mercado de granada,  este negocio lo comenzó con el apoyo de mama desde hace 11 años. Requiere del préstamo para la compra de pantalones de marca ECKO, para damas y caballeros. Ya que estos son de mayor demanda por parte de sus clientes. Nos expresó que con el crédito anterior logro iniciar en su otro negocio que es la crianza de cerdos. Lo cual ha podido mejorar sus ganancias y brindarle a su hijo mejores condiciones económicas. 
El resto de los miembros so Hayssell de 25 años, se dedica a la compra venta de cosechas, e invertirá en compra de aguacates. Mirna de 48 años prepara y vende nacatamales y comprara 2 cerdos. Julia de 56 años, se dedica a la elaboración de bordados y necesita del crédito para  la compra de telas dacron.
texts.en:
The "Sector Martínez" group is made up of 4 people with different businesses but only one goal: to grow their businesses. They come from the rural area of Granada. They are asking ADIM for a loan for the fifth time in order to buy supplies for their respective businesses.

The leader of the group is Jonathan, 25 years old. He is married and has 1 son who is 6 years old. He sells clothing and shoes in the market in Granada. He started this business with the support of his mom 11 years ago. He needs the loan to buy ECKO brand pants for ladies and gentlemen, since those are the ones in highest demand among his customers. He told us that with the previous loan he was able to start his other business, which is raising pigs. With it he has been able to improve his profits and provide better financial conditions for his son.

The rest of the members are Hayssell, 25 years old, who buys and sells crops and will buy avocados; Mirna, 48 years old, who buys and sells nacatamales (a Nicaraguan meat and rice dish) and will buy two pigs; and Julia, 56 years old, who does embroidery and needs the loan in order to buy Dacron fabrics.

loans.use: to buy ECKO brand pants for ladies and gentlemen

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 22 years old, married and a mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development and financial management. 

She practices poultry farming and also sells clothes to earn a living. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed to boost production of her poultry business. This will enable her to earn more income and be able to pay for the family's needs such as food, medicine and school fees.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed to boost production of her poultry business for increased income to pay for her family's needs such as food, medicine and school fees.

loans.name: Marling Josue

texts.es:
Marling es una joven de veintidós años de edad, dedicada a sus estudios y con un futuro prometedor, decidió estudiar la licenciatura en medicina general, porque desde pequeña ha tenido gran influencia de su padre que es visitador médico y su madre que es farmacéutica, además tiene un gran deseo por ayudar a los demás. 
Ella está a las puertas de nuevas oportunidades, dado que se encuentra en su último año de  la carrera, es por eso que ha recurrido a la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le brinde un préstamo que le permita cancelar su curso de titulación y los aranceles universitarios. Obtener su título y todos los permisos pertinentes para ejercer su carrera le brindaría mejores propuestas laborales. En su futuro desea instalar su propia clínica.
texts.en:
Marling is a 22-year old young woman.  She is dedicated to her studies and has a promising future.  She decided to get a general medical degree because since she was young, her father, who is a medical sales representative, has had a large influence on her.  And, her mother is a pharmacist.  In addition, Marling has a great desire to help others.  
Marling is at the threshold of new opportunities.  She is in the last year of her program, and that is why she has turned to Kiva, together with MiCrédito, for some help.  She wants a loan so that she can pay off her advanced degree courses and her university tuition.  Getting her degree and all the pertinent licenses to practice her profession will provide her with the best work opportunities. 
In the future, Marling wants to open her own clinic.

loans.use: to pay for her advanced degree courses and university tuition.

loans.name: Kiganjo Ushindi S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Joyce. She is 37 years old, married and a mother of four children.

Joyce joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. She has benefited a lot from HiH EA training, especially on financial and enterprise management where she gained skills in business management.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy feed to enhance her dairy farming, which will earn her more income and in return, meet family needs with ease.

Joyce is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for their assistance and promises to repay back promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed to enhance her dairy farming and earn more income to meet family demands with ease.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a wall in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Protas

texts.en: Protas is 30 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He is a farmer and has been in the farming business for the last four years. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income, and support his family.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Phylis. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children. Phylis joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the training on enterprise management, which has helped her manage her food kiosk business well.

Phylis is borrowing from Kiva to add more stock of food stuffs for her food kiosk. This will enable her meet customers' rising demand, which will enable her to earn more income. This will enable her to pay school fees for her children without difficulties. Phylis is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs that will boost income

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is 38 years old and she lives with her two children and husband in Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. Liana, with her family, is engaged in farming and agriculture. She used to work at the rest house as a cleaner, then at the bread factory as a baker. Now she is interested only in farming, which is the only income for the family. On the farm, Liana has cows, calves, a pig, chickens and rabbits. On her plot of land, with her husband, she cultivates potatoes, greens, tomatoes and cucumber. All her farm products she sells at the city wholesale market during the week. Liana hopes to develop her farming since her husband is unemployed and the family’s only income is the farm and its products. With great hope that Kiva lenders will support her, Liana asks for this loan to purchase potato seedlings, fertilizer and also fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings, fertilizer and also fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 54 años de edad que se ha desempeñado gran parte de su vida como comerciante de venta de ropa, ella trabaja con catálogos y realiza pedidos, en la foto se pude ver la mercadería que ella ofrece, este trabajo lo hace con amor porque sabe que ha representado la mejora continua de la calidad de vida para su familia conformada por su pareja y tres hijos, dos de ellos todos unos profesionales, actualmente el menor aún vive con ellos y se encuentra cursando la universidad, su meta es que él también termine sus estudios y se convierta en un profesional, ellos son su mayor orgullo.
María es una señora muy trabajadora, su esposo también es un gran apoyo en la familia, él trabaja operando maquinaria pesada.
María actualmente no cuenta con mucho capital, es por ello que acudió a la Fundación y gracias al crédito podrá comprar más ropa como blusas, pantalones y demás para poder capitalizarse y aumentar sus ingresos para seguir apoyando con la universidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
María is a 54-year-old woman who has worked for much of her life as a businesswoman in clothing sales. She works with catalogues and places orders; the merchandise she offers can be seen in the photo.
She does this work with love because she knows it has meant the continual improvement of her family’s quality of life. Her family consists of her partner and three children, two of whom are professionals. The youngest is currently still living with them and attending university. María’s goal is for him to finish his studies and become a professional as well. They are her greatest pride.
María is a very hardworking lady and her husband is also a big support to the family. He works operating heavy machinery.
Currently, María does not have much capital, which is why she turned to Fundación Alternativa. Thanks to the loan she will be able to buy more clothing like blouses, trousers and more, to be able to capitalize and increase her income to keep supporting her son’s university education.

loans.use: purchase clothing to be able to capitalize and support her son so that he can study at university.

loans.name: Dolphine

texts.en:
Dolphine is 38 years old, married and blessed with four children. She has been a farmer for the last eight years and the business has been profitable.
 
She will be using the loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and farming tools for use on her farm to increase her farm produce and generate more income to support her family.
 
She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and buy more farm inputs for use. Her future hope is to grow more cash crops to sell, make more income and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and farming tools for use on her farm to increase her farm produce and generate more income to support her family.

loans.name: Jose Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y es padre de 3 hijos, uno de ellos está acompañado y dos están el la escuela uno estudia 8° grado y otro 3ero  en su casa vive solo con su esposa y sus hijos.

Leonidas, trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 20 años, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y también trabaja como jornalero cerca de su casa en la comunidad.

Leonidas, necesita el dinero para comprar fertilizantes para preparar la tierra para sembrar granos básicos.

El sueño de Leonidas, es obtener un crédito más grande en la institución que le permita mejorar su vivienda y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Leonidas, 42 years old, studied until the third grade. He is the married father of three children, one of whom is married and two are in school. One is in the eight grade and the other is in third grade. Leonidas lives with his wife and their children. 

Leonidas has been working in agriculture for 20 years. He learned this trade from his father. He also works as a laborer near his home in this community. 

Leonidas needs capital to buy fertilizers to prepare his land for planting his staple crops. Leonidas’ dream is to obtain a larger loan from this institution so that he can improve his home and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to fertilize his farm lands

loans.name: Isumayiri

texts.en: Isumayiri is 63 years old, married with nine children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in a retail business selling mainly sugar, rice, maize flour, ground nuts and cooking oil. He also operates a milling machine and he is involved in cocoa growing to raise enough income for the family but is faced with challenges of inadequate capital and seasonality changes. Isumayiri is hardworking and operates on a busy street in town. He is requesting a loan to buy another milling machine for the second business.

loans.use: To buy a second milling machine

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha lives in Vanadzor town with his mother. His father is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country where he works hard to sustain his family's living. Misha is a student in the university and specializes in the pedagogical department. Misha also works in a local secondary school as a sport trainer. 

He asks for this loan to support him with his tuition fee. He hopes to receive the loan, pay for his university tuition and continue his studies there.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Argentina Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Argentina¨ está conformado por 3 varones, que necesitan del crédito para seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios. Por tercera vez están con ADIM. Su líder es Rolando, de 21 años, soltero y con 2 hijos de edades de 2 y 1 años. Con la ayuda de su hermano se inició en el negocio de la compra venta de cosechas en mercado de Masaya. Y requiere del préstamo para compra de cosechas de aguacate. Con el crédito anterior realizo mejoras a su casa y compro una cama  y un equipo de sonido. 
Los demás constituyentes del grupo son Roberto, 29 años, se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 2 años, en el mercado de municipal. Y Gilberto de 34 años, quien cría pollitos y cerdos en su localidad, para luego venderlos al detalle o por mayor. Así obtiene más ganancias y aporta a las mejoras del hogar.
texts.en:
The “Argentina” group is made up of three young men who require this loan to continue investing in their businesses. This is their third time with ADIM. Their leader is Rolando, a 21-year-old single father of two children, 1 and 2 years old. With the help of his brother, he started in the business of buying and selling crops at the market in Masaya. He needs the loan to buy avocado crops. With the previous loan, he made improvements to his home and bought a bed and a sound system.
The other group members are Roberto, age 29, who has worked selling tamales in the municipal market for the past two years, and Gilberto, age 34, who raises chicks and pigs in his town and later sells them retail or wholesale. He earns more profits this way and contributes to home improvements.

loans.use: purchase avocado crops.

loans.name: Yona

texts.en:
Yona, who is in his mid-40s, is married with two children who are still in school.  He has been running a transportation business for four years now.  He works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Yona’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to service his motorcycle and can now move smoothly and go a long distance without mechanical problems.  He has managed to pay back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to service his motorcycle. He dreams of building his own house.

Yona will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feed for more egg production and hopes this will enable him to get more eggs to supply.

loans.name: Lilian Jazmin

texts.es:
Lilian, de 24 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, actualmente vive en una casa que es de un familiar, para que la cuiden y trabajen con la tierra y ellos han decidido darle uso con la crianza de pollos.

Lilian, ha estado trabajando en la crianza y venta de pollos desde hace algún tiempo, ya que desde pequeña su madre y sus tías le enseñaron que si quería triunfar en la vida, debía trabajar duro. 

Lilian, necesita el dinero para comprar concentrado y vacunas para sus aves, ya que sus aves están en la etapa que más necesitan cuidado.

Lilian, sueña con seguir con su negocio y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en: Lilian, 24, is a young entrepreneur.  She is in a common-law relationship, and has three children.  Currently, they live in a house that belongs to a family member.   They take care of it and work the land, and they have decided to make use of it raising chickens.  Lilian has been breeding and selling chickens for some time.  When she was a small child, her mother and her aunts taught her that if she wanted to succeed in life, she would have to work hard.  Lilian needs the money to purchase concentrated feed and vaccines because her chickens are in the stage where they need the most care.  She dreams of continuing her business, and getting ahead with her children.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed and vaccines for her chickens.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: Amparo  de 29 años de edad habita en un municipio de Cundinamarca, muy cerca de la ciudad de Bogotá, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 3 y 5 años; La madre de Amparo, propietaria de un almacén en la población donde habitan, se dio cuenta que había un potencial para emprender un negocio de elaboración de accesorios y tarjetería y aprovechando las capacidades de  Amparo se lo propuso y ella de muy buena disposición, empezó este negocio,  con muy buena acogida entre su clientela y por esto ha creado una base de referidos que solicitan tarjetería a la medida de cada ocasión especial. Amparo vende de contado y su principal mercado está conformado por vecinos del municipio, familiares y amigos, quienes conocen el trabajo de calidad que en el negocio de Amparo les ofrece. Su meta es abarcar la totalidad de los eventos en Tibio, para vender más y ganar más con el propósito e lograr una educación de calidad para sus hijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará papel para tarjetas, cintas, entre otros insumos con los cuales planea incrementar su productividad  y seguir su sueño de aumentar cada vez más la calidad de vida de su familia. Con esta inversión  podrá incrementar la posibilidad compra y afianzar su oferta la cual inicia desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche todos los días, para hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Amparo, 29 years old, lives in a municipality in Cundinamarca, very close to the city of Bogotá, with her spouse and her two children aged 3 and 5. Amparo's mother, the owner of a store in the town where they live, realized that there was the potential to have a business making accessories and cards and taking advantage of Amparo's skills. It was proposed and she very willingly started this business, with a very good reception among her customers. Because of this she has created a base of referrals who ask for cards made to order for every special occasion. Amparo's sales are in cash and her main market is made up of neighbors from the municipality, family members, and friends, who know the quality work Amparo's business offers them. Her goal is to cover all of the events in Tibio, in order to sell more and earn more with the goal of achieving a quality education for her children. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy cards, ribbon, and other supplies, with which she plans to increase her productivity and follow her dream of increasing her family's quality of life more and more. With this investment, she will be able to increase the possibility to buy and to strengthen what she offers for sale, which starts from 8 in the morning until 7 at night every day, in order to make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy paper for cards, ribbon, and other supplies

loans.name: Hildebrando

texts.es:
Hildebrando tiene 70 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Niepos, en una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El brinda el servicio de alquiler de habitaciones brindando hospedaje, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio es por esto que tiene clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a la infraestructura de las habitaciones que alquila a sus clientes, dicha inversión le servirá para poder brindar un mejor serviico, con esto el espera poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hildebrando is 70 years old. He is married, has no children, and lives with his family in the district of Niepos in a rural area dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock. It is located in the Province of San Miguel, in the Cajamarca region, in the mountains of northern Peru. 

He offers the service of rental rooms providing accommodation. He has over 10 years of experience in this business which is why he has regular customers who give him very good professional and personal references. He is requesting a loan to make repairs and maintain the rooms he rents to customers. This investment will serve to provide better service with the hopes that he will meet the diverse needs, tastes, and requirements of his customers in the area. This will have a positive impact on his income level and will enhance quality of life for Hildbrando and his family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain rooms in the rooms he rents to clients

loans.name: Adule

texts.en:
Adule is married with four children and she lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

She deals in buying and selling fish and gets additional income from cocoa growing. She started the business in the year 2006; so far the profits are good. She is hardworking and plans to expand the business, but she faces the challenges of competition and dishonest customers with high default rates, which affects her profits. 

Adule has requested a loan to buy fish for selling to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 9 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luu is 31 years old, has been married and is the mother of a 9-year-old boy and a 3-year-old girl. She lives happily with her in-laws, her husband and her two children in a house in a small village. She works very hard on cultivation and animal husbandry to support her family and provide for her children. Indeed, she grows rice, peanuts, corn and breeds chickens, pigs and ducks. She has always wanted to increase agricultural production and improve productivity so that she can earn more and gradually enhance the family's income. For that reason, she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to have enough capital for investment in agricultural activities. This is the fourth time she has received a loan from the program and she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and plant seeds for cultivating rice and corn. She hopes that she will reap a bumper harvest, especially with the technical support of the Anh Chi Em's staff.

Mrs. Luu dreams that her children will study well, enter a good college, get a good job and have a bright future. In the picture, she is wearing a white top with a green bow, is standing on the second line, and is first from the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plant seeds for cultivating rice and corn

loans.name: Javier Ernesto

texts.es:
Javier, de 23 años de edad, estudio sexto grado, está acompañado y es padre de un niño de 2 años de edad.

Javier, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde hace 5 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre y también se dedica a trabajar de jornalero cuando tiene tiempo.

Javier, necesita el dinero para comprar fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra para sembrar granos básicos, ya que se acerca el invierno y es temporada de siembra.

Javier, desea obtener un crédito más grande en la institución, para mejorar la parcela donde cultiva y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Javier, 23, studied until the sixth grade. He is the married father of a 2 year old. Javier earns his living in agriculture, which is the work he has done for the past five years. He learned this work from his father. He also works as a laborer when he has time.

Javier needs capital to buy fertilizer and to pay laborers to plant his staple crops, as the winter planting season approaches. Javier wants to get a larger loan at this institution to expand his plot of land where he grows to get better returns.

loans.use: to fertilize his land and pay laborers to help him plant for the upcoming season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy feeds such as fodder and hay for his dairy cows in hopes this will enable him to get more milk to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el Distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos y patos, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de animales de corral para engorde y posteriormente ofrecerlo a sus clientes a un mejor precio, esto le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Zaña, a community engaged in agriculture, trade, and raising livestock. It is located in the Province of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque region in northern Peru. She earns her living breeding and selling small animals such as pigs and ducks. Her business is located in the back of her home. 

She has requested a loan for the purchase of farm animals for fattening. She will then sell them to her customers at a higher price, which will allow a higher income to improve the quality of life for Teresa and her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals to raise

loans.name: Nsagasa Farmers Group

texts.en: Aston is a 59-year-old married man with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of farming/growing bananas for commercial purposes. He faces challenges of dry seasons that affect crops and low market prices for bananas. However, he has a vision of expanding his farm to new areas. Aston has asked for a loan to improve his banana plantation.

loans.use: to improve his banana plantation.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He is a married hardworking man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is involved in the transport business and also owns a retail shop. Price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, plus high taxes pose challenges to his business dream. 

His personal goal is to build a permanent home while his business goal is to own a car for the transport business.

Aziz intends to use this loan to buy a fourth motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a fourth motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Rubona Visionary Dev't Group

texts.en:
Justine is a 30-year-old hardworking married mother of two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She grows crops especially cassava, maize, and millet. She also operates a grocery store to supplement her income and this has enabled her earn a living. She wishes to educate all her children up to university level but her main challenges are bad weather and stiff competition with other dealers in the same businesses as hers. 

Justine is requesting a loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot lives in Vanadzor town with his wife, daughter and son Shavarsh. Shavarsh is a student and he studies in the Pedagogical University in Vanadzor town. Ashot is now asking for this loan to be able to pay for his son's university tuition and give him an opportunity to continue his education in the university.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for his son.

loans.name: Olia

texts.en:
Olia is 53 years old and from Dusheti district. She lives with her husband and both family members get age pension, as well as social assistance, from the local government.

Olia seasonally cultivates a plot of land, where she harvests beans that are used for local trading. The family gets a small monthly income that is hardly enough to satisfy the basic needs of the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'vulnerable poor' category. 

Olia has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of a dairy farming business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products since they have low incomes and are regarded as “high risk borrowers.” 

Olia will purchase a milk cow and will start production of yogurt. She will sell it at the open market of the nearby town. As a result of the new business initiative implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will significantly increase and Olia will make better style of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and start producing yogurt.

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin, who is 41 years old, lives in the village of Etseri. He has a housekeeper wife, pensioner mother, daughter with husband and two granddaughters. Roin and his son-in-law work as private workers and get a small income. The family has poor living conditions as they don't have a significant source of income to cover all daily costs. 

As the existing income is not enough for a seven-member family, and Roin can’t find a job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, he applied for a loan from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Roin will purchase cattle and also build a cattle shed and after raising the cattle, he will start milking. They will produce milk products for local trading.

The family's living conditions will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and build a cattle shed

loans.name: Juan Tranquilino

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 49 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 5 y 8 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Lucía Utatlán.
Juan con el objetivo de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de accesorios para teléfonos celulares, pero para mejorar sus ingresos él trabaja también como piloto automovilístico.
A Juan gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien en su negocio de venta de accesorios para teléfonos celulares, pues el atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y respeto, es por ello que ahora se ve a la necesidad de adquirir un préstamo para poder surtir mejor su negocio y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes, aunque una de las dificultades que el tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta inversión, entonces junto a su esposa han tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que los ayudara a incrementar su mercadería como audífonos, protector de pantalla, cargadores, y otros.
El gran sueño de Juan es poder construir su casa para que su familia tenga una casa donde puedan vivir tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Juan is a man of 49 years of age. He is married and has a beautiful family with three children aged 5 to 8 years. The family lives in the community of Santa Lucía Utatlán. Juan has the goal of increasing his income and raising his family. He earns his living in the purchase and sale of accessories for mobile phones. To improve his income, he also works as a driver.

Juan is thankful to God because he has done very well in his business selling mobile phone accessories because he serves his customers with great kindness and respect. He needs a loan to better equip his business and better meet his customers’ needs. One of his difficulties is that he does not have enough capital to make this investment. Juan and his wife have decided to borrow the capital to help them increase their stock of headphones, screen protectors, chargers, and more. 

Juan’s greatest dream is to build a house for his family to have a home where they can live peacefully.

loans.use: to purchase headphones, screen protectors, and chargers to sell

loans.name: Peace Ladies Group

texts.en:
Francisca is 54 years old. She is a divorced woman with three children. The ages of her children are 25, 31, and 32, with only one child still in school. She comes from Cape Coast of the Central Region of Ghana. 

Francisca is the representative of Peace Ladies Group. She and her group have been with the field partner since 2007.  Francisca is a petty trader with 30 years of business experience. Francisca operates a stationery shop, selling all kinds of educational materials, toilet rolls, bags, and soap. 

She grew her business from selling on a tabletop, later opening a small kiosk, and finally opening a second small shop through the microloan facilities over the years from the field partner. She pursued her business expansion through location strategy to increase her sales. Two of her grown children are now her employees. Francisca is hoping to have an additional shop, which will be used as a retailing store, and a distribution van for her supplies in the future. 

Francisca is requesting additional working capital to buy stationery items, toilet rolls, bags, and soap to resell to meet her customers' demand.  The profit from her business will be reinvested into the business for future expansion to give more employment to the children and a better standard of living for the family.  

Francisca thanks all her microlenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To buy stationery items, toilet rolls, bags, and soap to sell

loans.name: El Capulin 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo mixto ¨El Capulín 1¨, coordinado por Pedro, de 58 años, casado. Se dedica a la compra venta de cosechas de  frutas, y las entrega directamente a comerciantes nacionales o internacionales. Con la ayuda de su esposa se ha mantenido en el negocio por 15 años, y solicita el crédito para la compra de cosechas de aguacates. Con las ganancias obtenidas obtendrá muchos beneficios económicos y seguirá aportando en la mejoría de la familia. 
Los demás integrantes son Lucila, de 35 años, quien ofrece el servicio de venta y reparación de bicicletas en su casa, desde hace 8 años, con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de llantas. Y Juan quien desde hace 7 años vende en el mercado municipal estufas y verduras y comprara cocinas para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The mixed group "El Capulin 1" is coordinated by Pedro, who is 58 years old and married. He makes a living buying and selling fruit crops, which he delivers directly to national and international merchants. With the help of his wife, he has been in this business for the past 15 years.

He is requesting a loan to purchase avocado crops. With the income that he earns, he will obtain many economic benefits, which will allow him to continue providing for the improvement of his family.

The other members are Lucila, who is 35 years old and has been offering sale and repair services for bicycles in her home for the past 8 years, and Juan, who has been selling stoves and vegetables in the town market for the past 7 years. Lucila will use this loan to buy tires, and Juan will use it to buy stoves to offer his customers.

loans.use: to purchase avocado crops.

loans.name: Seneyda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Seneyda, es una joven de 26 años,casada y con dos 2 hijos de edades de 11 y 5 años respectivamente. Esta con ADIM por novena vez, solicitando un préstamo para seguir engrandeciendo su negocio. Con el crédito pasado pudo hacer mejoras a su hogar, y compro hojas de zinc. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortillas en su casa y a veces de forma ambulante en su comunidad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña y comal. Ahora con las ganancias obtenidas, está en planes reparar el área de la cocina en su casa.
texts.en: Seneyda is a young 26 year old married woman with two children, ages 11 and 5. She is in her ninth loan cycle with ADIM, and is requesting a loan to continue expanding her business.  Her previous loan enabled her to make improvements to her home, and purchase zinc sheets.  She is engaged in preparing and selling tortillas in her home and sometimes sells them in the streets in her community.  She will use the loan to purchase corn, wood, and a griddle.  Now, with the profits that she is earning, she plans to repair the kitchen in her home.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, and a griddle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming through application of modern farming technology and earn more income so as to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy large quantities of milk

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 3 menores hijos en una comunidad rural ubicada en el distrito de San Felipe, la vida en esta comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo va a utilizar para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera mejorar la calidad del producto que brinda lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilder is 37 years old and lives in a house made of rustic materials with his spouse and three dependent children in a rural community in the district of San Felipe. Life in this community is quiet and the inhabitants work in agriculture, business and ranching. It is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.
Wilder cultivates coffee for a living, which he has done for the past five years. For this reason, he relies on experience in this business, as well as on good personal and work references in his district. He is going to use this loan to buy manure and fertilizer to provide maintenance for his coffee crops. With this, he expects to improve the quality of the product he provides, which will allow him to boost his income level and consequently improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: purchase manure and fertilizer to provide maintenance for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and apply modern farming technology

loans.name: Restauracion Group

texts.es:
Constituido por 3 mujeres emprendedoras está el grupo ¨Restauración¨ quienes solicitan a ADIM un préstamo para poder seguir creciendo sus pequeños negocios y así obtener más ingresos y hacer mejoras al hogar y progresar con sus familias. Marvell es la coordinadora del grupo, ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de nacatamales y refrescos, desde hace 8 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Con el crédito invertirá en la compra de maíz, cerdos, fletes de leña. Y con las ganancias obtenidas tiene pensado mejorar el techo de su casa. 
Las demás integrantes son Fátima, de 35 años quien prepara y vende tortillas, nacatamales y sopas en su hogar y Kelin de 25 años, quien prepara y vende nacatamales.
texts.en:
The "Restauración" group is made up of three entrepreneurial women. They are requesting a loan in order to continue to grow their small businesses, earn more income, improve their households, and progress with their families.

Marvell is the coordinator of the group. She has made a living for the past 8 years by selling nacatamales (a typical Nicaraguan dish made of filled corn dough wrapped in plantain leaves) and beverages with the help of her husband. She will use the loan to purchase corn, pork, and loads of firewood. She is thinking of improving her home's roof with hear earnings.

The other members are Fátima, who is 35 years old and prepares and sells tortillas, nacatamales, and soup in her home, and Kelin, who is 25 years old and prepares and sells nacatamales.

loans.use: to purchase corn, pork, and loads of firewood.

loans.name: Hpa Yar Ka Lay Village

texts.en:
The Featured Borrower, Tin is 55 years old, married, and supports a family of five (three children). Two of the sons, one is in 10th grade and the other in engineer college GTI (Government Technological Institute). The education cost is very expensive in Myanmar such as tuition fee, renting rooms and so on. Tin, has five acre crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season. The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizers and gas for farm equipments. These inputs are vital for his crop farming to increase yield. As farming has been done through generations, its in Tin's blood. In order to earn extra money, he is planning to expand his grocery shop from the income at the farm.

The fund will help 22 members and supervised by CBO Leaders of the Hpa Yar Ka Lay Village. Pictured above are Tin, Myint, Htay, Hla and Oo.

The group will purchase farming essentials such as seeds, fertilizers and gas for farming machines before harvest time. Hpa Yar Ka Lay Village mainly focuses on crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantation such as betel trees, banana trees and coconut trees, for additional income.

loans.use: To rent farm equipment, purchase petrol for farm equipment, and hire farm staff during harvest time.

loans.name: Yiritio's Group

texts.fr: Yiritio qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, étant entre deux hommes asseyant, est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Fogoba au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Yiritio, âgée de 59 ans, est la mère de 2 enfants âgés de 22 à 35 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Yiritio à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Yiritio cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, d'engrais de qualité et de semences de qualité. Yiritio entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Yiritio effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 2 ans que Yiritio cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Yiritio planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'étendre la surface cultivée. Enfin Yiritio espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Yiritio, who is in the center of the photo seated between two men, is a member of a group of 18 farmers registered in myAgro, living and working in the village of Fogoba in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Yiritio, aged 59, is the mother of two children aged 22 and 35, one of whom is presently in school. Family tradition being anchored in agriculture, principle source of revenue and of food self-sufficiency for the household, but also the fact that agriculture has allowed her to ensure self-sufficiency for her family has moved Yiritio to work in this field for 40 years now. 

Yiritio cultivates peanuts on her plot but as a farmer she also has to face difficulties such as lack of rain and of high-quality fertilizer and seeds. Yiritio is beginning her first year with myAgro and she registered because of the perspective of increasing her yield through the services proposed by myAgro.  

This year Yiritio is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts in order to expand the yield on her plot of 0.0625 hectare.  Yiritio has been growing peanuts for two years now for their value as a foodstuff, explaining the peanuts are directly edible by the family and are utilized as a basic sauce in cooking. They also have a commercial value, since peanuts are a foodstuff she sells at the market. 

With the increase in her yield and her income, Yiritio plans to raise livestock and expand her farmed land. Finally, she also hopes to be able to ensure the food self-sufficiency of her family.

loans.use: to acquire a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts in order to increase the agricultural productivity of her plot of land

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris, es una señora muy trabajadora, que estudio hasta noveno grado, pues en la época que ella estudiaba, en el país de desarrollaba el conflicto armado, sus hermanos y ella no podían salir de su casa pues tenían que refugiarse e incluso  tuvieron que salir hacia otro país para protegerse; actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos estudia bachillerato y su hija mayor estudia en la universidad.

Doris, su principal actividad es los oficios domésticos en su vivienda, desde pequeña su madre le enseño a cuidar la casa, además de esta actividad ella de dedica a vender frutas y verduras ambulantes, estos productos los compra a personas de la zona que cultivan las verduras y también se dedica a vender lácteos, este producto lo trae desde el país de honduras, ella tiene que salir un día antes de su casa, para regresar con los productos el día siguiente por la tarde,  después tiene que salir de su comunidad a venderlos casa por casa.

El financiamiento del préstamo lo utilizara específicamente para comprar 4 sacos de abono, fertilizantes, semilla y pagar mano de obra para preparar la tierra, gracias al financiamiento ellos podrán cultivar y tener sus propios granos.

Doris, sus sueños a futuro son que sus hijos logren sacar sus estudios universitarios, también desea tener una buena cosecha este verano. Pero su principal sueño, es tener su propia tienda de productos básicos.
texts.en:
Doris is a very hard working woman who attended school until the ninth grade. While she was in school, an armed conflict was developing in the country. She and her brothers could not leave the house, and had to take refuge; they even had to go to another country in order to protect themselves. She is currently married and her husband makes a living by working in agriculture. They have two children, one who attends high school and one who is in university. 

Doris primarily takes care of the domestic positions at home. When she was young, her mother taught her how to care for a household. She also sells fruits and vegetables. She purchases the products from people in the area who grow the products. She also sells dairy products, which she obtains from Honduras. She leaves her house one day and returns the next afternoon with the dairy products. Later, she goes door to door selling the products in her community.

She will use this loan to purchase 4 bags of manure, fertilizer, and seeds, and to pay laborers to prepare the land. Thanks to this loan, they will be able to cultivate and have their oen grains.

Doris' dreams for the future include her children graduating from university and having a good harvest this summer. Her greatest dream is to have her own business selling basic products.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of manure, fertilizer, and seeds, and to pay laborers to prepare her land.

loans.name: La Croyance 2.1 Group

texts.en:
Benijean is a member of the community bank group La Croyance 2.1 in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Helping to lead a group of nine other micro-entrepreneurs, Benijean has been working to buy and resell wood for the past year. Benijean is looking to move to his fourth loan with HOPE Congo and will use the loan to purchase wood products and boards for his store. 

At the age of 33 and a father of four, Benijean believes that having loyal clients is the key to his business success. Additionally, he has launched a second small business boutique and is hoping to expand into building his very own shops as well as a home for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase wood and boards for retail sales.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María tiene 50 años de edad y vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace muchos años junto a su padre y sus tres hijos de 18, 11 y 14 años de edad. Para sostener a sus hijos como madre soltera y estar pendiente de ellos María decidió hace 10 años instalar una tienda de productos básicos, en la cual se ha apoyado para sostener a su hijos brindándoles educación y todo lo que está en sus manos. Frente a la vivienda de María en época de invierno se acumula una gran cantidad de agua que ingresa a su vivienda, lo que causa el daño de sus pocas pertenencias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención y  una canaleta para que el agua corra y no se estanque frente a su vivienda, por lo que espera contar con este apoyo lo antes posible y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 50 years old and has lived in a house on her property for many years with her father and her three children aged 11, 14, and 18. To support the children as a single mother, and to look out for them, María decided 10 years ago to install a store selling staple products, which has helped her to support her children, providing them with education and everything she has. In winter, a large quantity of water accumulates in front of her house and enters it, which causes damage to her few possessions. Because of this, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build a retaining wall and a gutter so the water will flow and not back up in front of her house. She hopes to have this support as soon as possible and in this way improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a retaining wall and a gutter in front of her house

loans.name: Angélica Elena

texts.es:
Angélica es una mujer de 20 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda hija de seis meses, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Angélica con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con  los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, ella tiene cuatro años de realizar esta labor.
Angélica gracias al entusiasmo que le pone a su trabajo de elaboración de ropa típica, tiene mucha clientela, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más hilos de tipo seda, alemán, lustrina y seguir elaborando las hermosas blusas de su pueblo, lleno de figuras y colores.
El gran sueño de Angélica es contar con un local propio donde pueda exhibir mejor su producto y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Angelica is a 20 year-old woman.  She is married and has a beautiful 6 month-old daughter.  She is from a humble family that lives in the community of Chichicastenango.

With the desire to obtain income and support her husband with the household expenses, Angélica started a business making traditional clothing.  She has 4 years of experience with this business.

Thanks to the enthusiasm with which she does her work making traditional Guatemalan clothing, Angelica has a lot of customers.  This is why she is requesting a loan to buy more silk thread, German embroidery thread, and embroidery floss, so that she can continue to make beautiful blouses typical of her town that are full of figures and colors.

Angelica's greatest dream is to have her own store where she could display her products better and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy embroidery thread
